Francia is dedicated to fighting for her business forever.  Additionally, with the earnings from her business, she is planning to repair her mother's home little by little and see her happy.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and the ingredients for her ice creams.

loans.name: Virgen Del Paso Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen del Paso está en su ciclo número 3 del programa es un comité de mujeres organizadas y trabajadoras. La mayoría de estas señoras se dedican a la venta de productos y luchan por poder crecer y ayudar a su familia.
Cristina es parte de este grupo, ella vende bebidas de todo tipo, comenta que por medio de las ventas que hace, procura ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que está luchando por crecer y ser alguien en la vida.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas varias para la venta, como ser gaseosas, cervezas, vinos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y ventas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Paso Group is in its third loan cycle with the program; it is a communal bank of organized and hardworking women.  The majority of these women sell products for a living and work hard to be able to grow and help their families.  

Cristina is part of this group; she sells all kinds of drinks for a living.  She tells us that, through her sales, she is able to improve living conditions for herself and her family.  She is a very hardworking woman who is putting in effort to grow and be someone in life.  

She is requesting this loan to buy different kinds of drinks to sell, such as soft drinks, beers, wines, and others, so she can keep working and making sales.  She is thankful for the opportunity she has received to be able to move forward.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beers, wines, and other kinds of drinks to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es dueña de una despensa y venta de bebidas en general en su local propio. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y muy honesta.
Empezó con un pequeño kiosko, pero poco a poco ha ido creciendo hasta montar una surtida despensa, la cual siempre fue su sueño. Ella esta luchando para poder ir creciendo y mejorando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, panificados, frutas, bebidas y demás, de manera a poder seguir creciendo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Margarita is the owner of a grocery and general liquor store in her own storefront.  She is a very hardworking, responsible, and honest person.  

She started out with a small kiosk, but little by little she has grown to the point of setting up a stocked grocery store, which has always been her dream.  She is working to grow and improve every day.  

She is requesting this loan to buy various supplies for her grocery store, such as vegetables, baked goods, fruits, drinks, etc., so she can keep developing in her work.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, baked goods, fruits, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталья успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Натальи есть 1 корова, 3 бычка и 10 свиней. На ежедневной основе она продает экологически-чистое молоко. Ежемесячная прибыль Натальи составляет 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Наталья обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 2 дойных коров и сена для скота. Наталья поняла, что продажа экологически-чистого, домашнего молока приносит хорошую прибыль, поэтому она хочет увеличить эту сферу деятельности. Доходы от кредита Наталья планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а также планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома, она планирует установить паровое отопление.
texts.en: Natalya used her previous loan as intended and successfully paid it off.  She is thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her get this financing.  She currently owns one cow, three young bulls and 10 pigs.  She sells organic milk on a daily basis.  She makes a monthly income of 30,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 (KGS) which will help her to buy two dairy cows as well as feed for her livestock.  Natalya realized that producing and selling organic milk can be a profitable business and, for this reason, she wants to increase this particular area of her activity.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her number of farm animals.  She would also like to save enough money to renovate her house and install central heating.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to produce and sell more organic milk.

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en:
Princess Jean is 20 years old and is the oldest of the five children in the family. Her mother, Jenie, is a member of NWTF, and supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Princess Jean is studying a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and is currently in the third year of this 4 year course.

Jenie is borrowing PHP 10000 to pay the tuition fees of her daughter Princess Jean for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Princess Jean plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is a 32-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are currently in school.

Madelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Madelyn requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Madelyn has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Madelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Luzminda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fish vending. Luzminda is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional materials needed for her fishing business.

Luzminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials needed for her fishing business.

loans.name: Oasis Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama OASIS cuenta con diecisiete integrantes, están en el 7mo ciclo, todas las mujeres de este grupo son muy emprendedoras. La mayoría de ellas se dedica a la cría de animales y a otras actividades rurales.
La Sra. Herminia es integrante de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que poco a poco se ha abierto camino, ella cría y vende animales de corral, y con ello se gana la vida de una forma humilde y honesta.
Herminia es parte de este grupo para poder invertirlo en la compra de animales para la cría,  para que de esa forma pueda seguir luchando y esforzándose para crecer.
texts.en:
The OASIS Communal Bank has 17 members; they are in their seventh loan cycle; all of the women in this group are very enterprising.  The majority of them raise animal and do other kinds of rural work. 

Herminia is a member of this group; she is a very hardworking woman who has paved her own way little by little; she raises and sells farm animals and earns her living in a simple and honest way.  

Herminia is part of this group so she can animals to raise so she can keep working and applying herself to grow.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Kuña Rory se encuentra en el primer ciclo este grupo, se formo en la ciudad de Santaní, una ciudad eminentemente rural, que está en crecimiento, y donde todas las integrantes se dedican a actividades rurales.
Estela es parte de este grupo, ella al igual que todas las integrantes de este grupo, se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos y otros. Ella comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero que lo hace por su familia, para darles todo o que necesitan para una mejor vida.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de animales para la cría y venta de animales. Agradece por la oportunidad que reciben de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Kuña Rory and it is in its first loan cycle; it was started in the city of Santaní, an especially rural city that is growing and where all of the group's members work in farming.  

Estela is part of this group; she, like all the members of this group, works raising and selling farm animals, such as chickens, pigs, and others.  She tells us that her work is very demanding, but that she does it for her family to give them everything they need for a better life.  

She is requesting this loan to buy animals to raise and sell.  She is thankful for the opportunity they have received to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
This is Jeneth. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy additional hogs and feed which was needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business further. This new loan of PHP 25,000 will be used to buy additional supplies of feed and hogs which will increase her profit. An increase in profit will also help her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family.

Jeneth hopes to grow and expand her piggery as she wants to give her family a better life someday. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase feed and additional hogs

loans.name: Hazel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Hazel es una joven de 26 años de edad, carismática y emprendedora, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos. Creció viendo el trabajo de su madre, quien vendía refrescos naturales, ahora ella, desde hace 2 años, ha heredado este mismo negocio, el cual, le ayuda a salir poco a poco adelante. 
A esta joven emprendedora le gustaría dar a conocer sus productos en todos los mercados de su municipio, pero primero quiere invertir en la ampliación de su negocio, por ello, solicita el crédito para la compra de pan, gaseosas, jugos, galletas entre otros y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes. Las metas de Hazel son poder incluir la venta de comida entre sus productos y llegar a ser en un futuro un negocio integral donde el cliente encuentre de todo.
texts.en:
Hazel is a young lady of 26; she is charismatic and enterprising and she is the single mother of two children.  She grew up watching her mother work selling natural soft drinks and two years ago she inherited this very business, which helps her get ahead little by little.  

This enterprising young woman would like to offer her products in all the local markets, but first she wants to invest in expanding her business, which is why she is requesting this loan to buy bread, soft drinks, and cookies, among other things so she can offer her customers more variety.  Hazel's goals are to include prepared foods in the products she sells and, in the future, to become a well-rounded business where the customer can find anything and everything.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks, juices, and cookies, among other things.

loans.name: Arasaty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Arasaty está en su ciclo número 12 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder ir mejorando la situación de pobreza de cada una.
Laura pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales, que le permitirá poder continuar en la venta de remedios naturales que viene haciendo, y con lo cual está ayudando a su familia a tener una vida digna.
Laura se define a sí misma como una persona que quiere salir adelante, y es por ello que se está esforzando por un porvenir mejor.
texts.en:
The group called "Arasaty" is in its 12th loan cycle in the women's committee program, where all the members are doing the survey on eliminating poverty in order to be able the understand the life situation of each one and according to it, be able to continue improving the poverty situation of each one.

Laura is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of natural medicines, which will allow her to continue selling natural medicines as she has been doing, and with this she is helping her family to have a dignified life.

Laura defines herself as a person who wants to get ahead, and it is for that reason that she is striving for a better future.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines to sell

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru: Бурул, 56 лет, вдова, мать 4 детей, самому младшему - 17 лет. У Бурул - среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав более 20 лет назад. Благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Бурул, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть: 2 коровы, 2 теленка, 1 жеребенок и 14 овец. Летом скот отгоняют на пастбище, зимой содержат в сараях. Ежемесячная прибыль Бурул составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). Этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому Бурул, посоветовавшись со своими детьми решила взять кредит на дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) для покупки телят. Бурул намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что приведет к получению большей совокупной прибыли от перепродажи.
texts.en: Burul is 56 years old, a widow, and the mother of four children.  Her youngest child is 17 years old.  Burul has a secondary education.   As an additional source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry for more than 20 years.  Thanks to her determination and very hard work, she currently owns two cows, two calves, one foal, and 14 sheep.  In the summer, the livestock is put out to pasture, in the winter Burul keeps her animals in a barn.  She makes a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS), which is not enough for a decent living.  For this reason, and after discussing with her children, Burul has decided to take a loan to further grow her business.  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 125,000 som (KGS), which will help her to buy calves.  Burul wants to increase her cattle headcount in order to boost her total earnings from animal sales.

loans.use: to buy additional calves in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru: Анаркул 61 год, замужем, мать 2 детей. Анаркул имеет среднее образование, по характеру она спокойный и общительный человек. В поисках дополнительного источника дохода, 40 лет назад она начала заниматься разведением скота. Анаркул приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 5 овец, ежедневно продает молоко. Также есть надел мерою 3,60 ГА орошаемой земли, где Анаркул выращивает ячмень. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаркул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков и 5 овец. В будущем, Анаркул планирует и дальше расширять свою деятельность, чтобы накопить на покупку автомобиля для ее семьи.
texts.en: Anarkul is 61 years old, married, and she has two children.  She has a secondary education and is by nature quiet and sociable.  Forty years ago, as she was looking for an additional source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry.  She has worked very hard to grow her business, and she currently owns five cows and five sheep.  She sells milk every day.  She also grows barley on 3.6 hectares of irrigated land.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS), which will help her to buy two steers and five sheep.  In the future, she would like to continue to expand her activity, so that she can buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase two steers and five sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: San Ignacio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Ignacio está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante. Las integrantes son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren salir adelante para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
La Sra. Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada, ella es empleada domestica, pero también quiere poder emprender otro trabajo para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia, comenta que pide este préstamo para la compra de ropas y volver a venderlas para así tener más ingresos en la casa. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a kiva por la confianza depositada en el grupo y en su persona-
texts.en:
The San Ignacio Group is in its first loan cycle with the women's communal bank program where they all work and help each other to get ahead.  The group members are women who are the heads of their household who want to get ahead to give their families everything they need.  

Carmen is a very hardworking and selfless woman; she is a housekeeper, but she also wants to start another job to improve living conditions for her and her family.  She tells us she is requesting this loan to buy clothing she can sell so she will have more household income.  She thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the confidence they have place in the group and in her personally.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothing to sell

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El grupo la alegria está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Librada , quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir en un nivel medio, donde a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo y por medio de la venta de lencería y cosméticos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar lencería y cosméticos para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por mejorar cada día mas.
texts.en:
The La Alegría Group is in its ninth loan cycle with the women's communal bank program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead.  

They are taking a survey on eliminating poverty where three of the women are under the poverty line, which is to say they live in extreme poverty.  

One of the group members is Librada, who during the last survey found herself in the second level of poverty, which is to say the medium level.  She puts effort and work into selling lingerie and cosmetics.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is fighting to grow and get ahead.  

She is requesting this loan to buy lingerie and cosmetics to sell, which will allow her to work toward improving every day.

loans.use: to buy garments and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials (milk derivatives) and containers to pack the product.

loans.name: Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Mburucuya está en su ciclo número 1º es un grupo unido, donde cada una se comprometió a dar lo mejor de sí, para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. 
La Sra. Maria, una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de comestibles, ella está muy contenta porque a través de las capacitaciones ha ido creciendo y quiere seguir haciéndolo. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer comidas, como verduras, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su emprendimiento, y luchar por ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This group bears the name "Mburucuya." It is in its first loan cycle. It is a united group, where each one promised to give the best of herself in order to be able to continue improving her living conditions and those of her family.

Señora Maria, one of the members, sells food. She is very happy because through the training she has been growing and wants to continue doing so. She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy ingredients to prepare food, such as greens, condiments, vegetables, and other items, and in this way be able to continue with her business venture and work to help her family.

loans.use: to buy greens, condiments, vegetables, and other items

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roselyn is 36 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Roselyn has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies for her business.

Roselyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos: Es un señor de 54 años de edad, originario de la comunidad de Kukalaya que se encuentra a 25 kms. de Rosita, es de carácter sereno y amable. Tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad que trabajan con él en la finca.  Está solicitando financiamiento para hacer mejoras en su finca que necesita cercar para evitar el daño de vacas que dañan los cultivos que siembra. El crédito lo utilizará para comprar malla ciclón, madera y grapas para el cercado. Su sueño es llegar a tener una finca bien establecida con diferentes cultivos y actividades pecuarias que le genere buenos ingresos y donde pueda construir su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a man of 54. He is originally from the community of Kukalaya, which is located 25 km from Rosita. He is of even-tempered and friendly character. He has two children who are already adults and who work with him on the farm. 

He is applying for financing in order to make improvements on his farm, which he needs to enclose to avoid the harm from the cows that damage the crops that he plants. He will use the loan to buy cyclone fence, wood, and staples for the enclosure. 

His dream is to have a well established farm with various crops and animal-raising activities that will generate good income for him and where he can construct his concrete residence.

loans.use: to make improvements in his farm, which he needs to enclose

loans.name: Muñecas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 4 mujeres emprendedoras (Rosaura, Linda Lenita, Secilia y Delfina), viven en  Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Hace 3 meses se organizaron en grupo solidario con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Las tres tienen pequeños negocios, Rosaura y Secilia venden pescados y mariscos, Delfina vende bananos, plátanos, yuca y Linda Lenita tiene una pequeña pulpería.

Rosaura: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven amable, con cualidades de líder, tiene 23 años de edad, casada. Su esposo trabaja como ayudante en un bote que sale a pescar. Ella desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos que compra en la comunidad miskita Lamlaya, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Está solicitando su primer préstamo para comprar más mariscos y pescados para vender más, incrementar sus ingresos y tener más clientes que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. Su sueño es llegar a ser una comerciante dueña de una tienda donde venda productos básicos y ropa.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is formed by four entrepreneurial women (Rosaura, Linda Lenita, Secila, and Delfina). They live in Bilwi, in the township of Puerto Cabezas. Three months ago they organized themselves in a solidarity group with the goal of working in a united manner to access the loans of Pana Pana and have the opportunity to improve their little businesses, improve their income, and thus improve the quality of life of their families. They have little businesses. Rosaura and Secila sell fish and shellfish, Delfina sells bananas, plantains, and yucca, and Linda Lenita has a little grocery store.

Rosaura is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a friendly young woman with leadership qualities. She is 23 years old and is married. Her husband works as an assistant in a boat that goes out to fish. For three years she has sold fish and shellfish that she buys in the Miskito community Lamlaya. In this way, she generates her own income and contributes to the household expenses. She is applying for her first loan to purchase more shellfish and fish in order to sell more, increase her income, and have more customers who request this product, which constitutes one of the basic foods in Bilwi. Her dream is to be a business person, owner of a store where she sells basic products and clothing.

loans.use: to buy more shellfish and fish

loans.name: Marinero Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario, es mixto está conformado por un hombre y 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Yuris, María Estela, Teresa, María Luisa), todos viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Es un grupo nuevo que se organizó recientemente con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para accesar a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, aumentar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Yuris tiene una pequeña carnicería, María Estela es vendedora ambulante de cosméticos, Teresa es dueña de una pequeña pulpería y María Luisa es vendedora de queso.

Yuris: Es el coordinador del grupo solidario, es un hombre luchador, con deseos de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, con cualidades de líder.  Desde hace 3 años estableció su carnicería, en un tramo que alquila en el mercado municipal. Está solicitando su primer crédito para comprar: carne de res, pollo, cerdo, carne molida de res y de pollo. El sueña con tener su propia casa construida de concreto, cerca de la cual también pueda construir el local de su negocio,  pues actualmente tiene que pagar alquiler.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is mixed. It consists of one man and three entrepreneurial women (Yuris, Maria Estela, Teresa, Maria Luisa). They all live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. It is a new group that was organized recently with the goal of working in a united manner to access the loans of Pana Pana and have the opportunity to improve their little businesses, increase their income, and thus improve the quality of life of their families. Yuris has a little butcher shop, Maria Estela is a street vendor of cosmetics, Teresa is the owner of a little grocery store, and Maria Luisa is a seller of cheese.

Yuris is the coordinator of the solidarity group. He is a hard-working man with leadership qualities and the desire to improve the living conditions of his family. Three years ago he established his butcher shop in a section that he rents in the municipal market. He is applying for his first loan to purchase beef, chicken, pork, ground beef, and ground chicken. He dreams of having his own house made of concrete, near which he could also construct a shop for his business, since he now has to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, pork, ground beef, and ground chicken.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Su población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El trabaja brindando servicio de transporte en el distrito de Santo Tomás, cuenta con un vehículo (combi) con el que brinda este servicio, desde hace 4 años viene desempeñándose como chofer, es conocido por la labor que realiza, amabilidad y servicio que brinda es por esto que cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de herramientas de trabajo que le permitan brindar mantenimiento y realizar reparaciones en su vehículo, con esto Elmer espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elmer is 35 years old. He lives in the St. Thomas district, which is located in the Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru. The location’s population makes its living primarily in agriculture, commerce, and raising animals.

He works by providing transportation service in the St. Thomas district. He has a vehicle (a 12-passenger van) which he uses to provide this service. He has been working as a chauffer for 4 years. He is known for his work, his kindness, and the service he provides. It is for this reason that he has very good personal and professional references in the area. He has requested a loan to buy tools for work which will allow him to complete maintenance and repairs for his vehicle. With this, Elmer hopes to provide better service to his customers, which will be reflected in his income level and will allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools for work which will allow him to complete maintenance and repairs for his vehicle.

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora is 36 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Cora works very hard to provide for them.

Cora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc. Cora has been in this business for 2 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future Cora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Susan is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more materials and tools for her business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is 56 years old and married.

Verginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Verginia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Arsenia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Arsenia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Arsenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 37 years old and married with three children. With all three children in school, Ludivina works very hard to provide for them.

Ludivina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

Ludivina has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, Ludivina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages and groceries

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and married with four children. With three of her children in school, Maricel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

Maricel has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, beverages, and groceries

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Katupyry está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Estelbina es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la cría de animales, compra y ventas de carne de chanco y trabajo en la agricultura, ella está contenta por formar parte del programa de comité de mujeres.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compras de animales para la cría, como también de balanceados para poder seguir con su trabajo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group named Kuña Katupyry is in its 4th cycle of its communal bank of women. The group is from the city of Curuguaty, which is a little far away from the central zone. Still it continues to grow, because the members of this group want to fight to continue growing and give the area in which they live a better environment, and in that way they will continue to grow slowly. 

Estelbina is one of the members. She makes a living raising animals. She buys and sells pork and worked in agriculture. She is happy to be a part of the program of the communal bank of women.

She is asking for this loan to buy animals to raise, as well as animal feed, to continue her work. She appreciates the opportunity she is receiving so that she will be able to continue improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy animals to raise, and animal feed.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of a seven-year-old child. She is from Montebello, Leyte. 

She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than two years now. This is the main source of her income. She also sells rice for supplemental income. 

Marilou is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for her business. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as increase her income and profits. In the future, Marilou hopes of making her business a success and sustainable. She also wants to save money for her child's schooling.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for her business.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es: Doña Ramona es madre soltera, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de perfumes, ella no encuentra trabajo debido a que tiene una edad ya mayor, por lo que ha decidido poner su propio negocio con el cual le ha ido bien para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante, sin embargo ella necesita hacer de una inversión para comprar mas mercadería por lo que solicita un préstamo de seiscientos mil colones (600.000). Con este préstamo ella podrá seguir mejorando su empresa y así seguir dando el sustento a su familia,
texts.en: Ramona is a single mother. She has a small business that sells perfumes. She hasn’t found work due to the fact that she is already a mature-aged worker, which is why she has decided to set up her own business. It has been going well for her and helps her to support her children; however, she needs to make an investment in order to buy more merchandise, which is why she is requesting a loan of 600,000 CRC. With this loan, she will be able to continue improving her business and thereby continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell perfumes

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of one daughter, from Montebello, Leyte. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. Josephine is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as her income and profit. In the future, Josephine hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for barrels of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mars

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mars works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling household products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing. Mars is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more household products for resale for her household product sales business.

Mars has been sustaining her business activities through a past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more household products for resale.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nila works hard to support her family.

She has a ice cream vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a food vending business. Nila is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her ice cream vending business.

Nila has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream vending business.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristy is 32 years old now.

Cristy has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Cristy has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Monaida

texts.en:
Monaida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of cultured pearls business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of cultured pearls to sell in her business.

Monaida has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cultured pearls to sell

loans.name: Nestora Maria

texts.en:
Nestora Maria is 58 years old and has six children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Nestora Maria is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nestora Maria has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nestora Maria would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Bunroeun

texts.en:
Bunroeun is a 55-year-old married mother of five children who lives in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. To earn a living, she makes sweets and snack foods to sell and she has been in this business since 2008. Among her five children, two are working in a factory, one is a driver and two are in school. Her husband is a 69-year-old rice farmer. Together, they can make around 25 USD each day. 

Bunroeun is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and also for family use. With this loan, she will have enough finances to buy a motorcycle for her children, so they will be able to have better traveling conditions. For Bunroeun’s plans, she is going to buy more farmland for her husband to cultivate rice and to help her children go through high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and also for family use.

loans.name: Imasumac Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal IMASUMAC, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia María Carmen, la socia continua con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes entre otros, la socia  se siente agradecida  por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo sus productos a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades,familaires entre otros, la socia continua también vendiendo ropa ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colonias entre otros.

Los demás socios se dedican a la lavandería, diseños de interiores, librería, trabajadores de empresa privada.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the “Imasumac” communal bank. The bank is located in the district and department of Cusco.

The borrower’s name is María Carmen. She is continuing with her business of selling beauty products, such as creams and perfumes. She is grateful for the loan granted to her and is committed to making her repayments on time. She is a responsible and diligent person. She continues to sell her products to her clients, who are friends, relatives, and others. She also continues to sell clothing. This is how she supports her family.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy colognes and other things.

The other members make a living from running a laundry, interior design, a bookstore, and working for private companies. 

The members appearing in the attached photo asked permission to come late to the meeting due to work reasons.

loans.use: to buy colognes and other things

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan enriched her business. She was able to buy supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business further if you will let her borrow again an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go towards buying additional nail polish, a cuticle remover, a pusher, a nail trimmer and other materials she needs to improve her service. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Rosalinda wants to improve her family's present financial condition and she also desires to have a deeper relationship with God. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, a cuticle remover, a pusher, a nail trimmer and other materials which are needed to improve her manicure and pedicure service.

loans.name: Eufronia

texts.en:
Eufronia is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eufronia is 56 years old now.

Eufronia has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. Eufronia requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Eufronia has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
As a married parent of 11 children, Alberta works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Alberta is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Alberta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Teódulo

texts.es:
Teódulo, de 78 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pero aprendió a escribir y leer, está soltero y tuvo 5 hijos, 2 de ellos viven con él, uno trabaja en la agricultura y el menor estudia séptimo grado. 

Teódulo, trabaja en la agricultura y ganadería por más de 20 años, este oficio lo aprendió por medio de sus padres.- Actualmente, siembra 28,000 metros cuadrados de maicillo y 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y lo hace en un terreno ubicado a la par de su casa.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar pasto, ya que por el momento no cuenta con el alimento suficiente, para alimentar a su ganado. 

El sueño de Teódulo, es seguir trabajando en el campo y tener una buena cosecha, además espera que su ganadería crezca y que su hijo termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
78-year-old Teódulo did not have the opportunity to study, but he did learn how to read and write. He is single and he has five children. Two of his children live with him, one works in agriculture, and the youngest is in the seventh grade.

Teódulo has worked in farming and ranching for more than 20 years. He learnt this trade from his parents. He currently sows 28,000 square metres of sorghum and 7,000 square metres of maize. He does this in a plot of land located next to his house.

He needs the loan in order to buy fodder, since at the moment he does not have enough food to feed his cattle.

Teódulo’s dream is to continue working in the field and to have a good harvest. He also hopes that his livestock business grows and that his son finishes his studies.

loans.use: to buy fodder

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es: A sus 27 años de edad Armando es un joven soltero, vive con su hermanastra y los hijo de ella, Armando se dedica al jornal y a la crianza de animales menores, Armando necesita el crédito para comprar pollos y tenerlos en corrales que le prestan ahí donde vive, Armando aspira que le vaya bien en su negocio ya que recién empezó con esta actividad, para ayudarse con los gastos de pago de arriendo, servicios básicos, vestido, alimentación y de ser posible de juntar un capital para mejorar su negocio y apoyar en la casa en la que vive.
texts.en: At 27 years of age, Armando is a single young man. He lives with his stepsister and her children. Armando is a day labourer and he also raises small animals. Armando needs the loan in order to buy chickens and house them in borrowed poultry yards.   Armando aspires to it going well for him in his business since he recently started this work and he needs it for paying for rent, basic services, clothes, and food. In addition, if possible, he wants to raise capital to improve his business and help out in the house where he lives.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Kuña Renda San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Renda San Miguel está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes, la Sra. Ignacia, se dedica a la venta de ropas variadas, también se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, quien hace un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Ignacia pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras, luchadoras y por sobre todo muy sacrificada.
texts.en:
The group named “Kuña Renda San Miguel” is participating in the poverty elimination survey. The results indicated that six of the members are below the poverty line, which means that they are in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Sra. Ignacia, who sells various types of clothes. The work of Fundación Paraguaya should also be highlighted. The organization is always making sure that training and monitoring is provided in some manner. At the same time, the women are motivated to do their best so that they can overcome poverty.

Sra. Ignacia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of various types of clothes. This will enable her to continue her sales just as before. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can improve her living conditions.

All of the women and hardworking and determined. Above all else, they are self-sacrificing.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es:
La socia Gabina se sigue dedicando al trabajo como limpieza y cocina, la socia es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora y por medio de estos pequeños trabajos quiere salir adelante. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un equipo de sonido.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gabina continues to work as a housekeeper and cook. She is a hardworking and determined woman. Gabina wants to get ahead by working at her small jobs.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy sound equipment. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment.

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men, aged 38, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He is a father of three children. 

To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, primarily growing rice and selling his agricultural product to the local dealers. He has been in this type of business for twenty-five years. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 4 a day.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore he is taking out a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, he can help his family members to gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental impact. 

He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
This is Bonifacia. She is 53 years old and she resides with her family in Palawan, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (general) store for years now, and she profits well from this. Having more responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a sari-sari store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every day.

To improve sales, Bonifacia would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 25,000 PHP, she could already purchase larger quantities and a greater variety of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Bonifacia hopes to maintain an increasing profit from her business. She dreams for her family to be always happy and healthy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is 51 years old and is happily married to Regalado. God has blessed them with three children and all of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard, but by the grace of God, they have been able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Edna owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in a community, and it is either just connected to their house or just inside it. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, one egg, and other things. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price and then sells them per piece for a higher price to make a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby, and the people in the community. She earns PHP 1,000 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting PHP 50,000 to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Edna desires to always meet the needs of her family, and she hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Annalee

texts.en:
Annalee is 37 years old and single.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Annalee is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Annalee has been in pig fattening for 10 years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 37 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Leonarda is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonarda has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Leonarda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice. Josefina is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fish vending business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Elvira requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, thread, buttons, etc., for her business.

Elvira has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, thread and buttons for her business.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jenny is 46 years old and three of her children are in school.

Jenny has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Jenny requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more used clothes for resale.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jenny has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 62 years old and married with five children.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

Evelyn has been raising livestock for one year now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Evelyn would like to save enough money in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Juvy is 42 years old and three of her children are in school.

Juvy has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Juvy has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Leosarda

texts.en:
Leosarda is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Leosarda requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Leosarda has been in this business for 13 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 61 years old and single.  

Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her general store.

Lilia has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as biscuits, canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles, cereals, coffee, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 31 years old and has two children. Crisanta is married. Her children are in school.

Crisanta is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Crisanta requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Crisanta has been in this business for ten years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Crisanta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is single and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 61 years old and married. She has six children, three of whom are still in school.

Merlyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat is a 36-year-old, widowed mother with three dependent children. She resides in the Kampong Chhnang Province in Cambodia. 

As a widowed mother, she can make some income from making clay piggy banks and other souvenirs to sell, earning around $7 a day. She has been in this business for over 10 years. Two of her children sell fish at a market, earning about $5 a day, and one attends school. 

Sophat wants to earn more income to improve her family’s living standards, so she has decided to request a loan to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell. 

For her next plan, she is going to expand her present business.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Juan Evangelista

texts.es:
Juan Evangelista tiene 59 años, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus tres menores hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo, que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su distrito, cuenta con un vehículo propio (mototaxi) en el que brinda este servicio. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como patos, gallinas, pavos, entre otros. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 5 años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de herramientas para realizar reparaciones y brindar mantenimiento a su vehículo, con esto Juan Evangelista espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Evangelista is 59 years old and resides in his own home along with his wife and their three young children. They reside in the District of Querocotillo in Cutervo Province, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in this district is peaceful. The residents engage primarily in agriculture, trade, and raising animals.

Juan Evangelista provides public transportation services in his district. He has his own vehicle (a motorcycle taxi) for providing this service. In addition, he raises and sells animals such as ducks, chickens, turkeys, and other livestock. Juan Evangelista has been in business for five years. He has experience in this line of work and has very good personal and work-related references who are from the area.

His loan will be used to buy tools for making repairs and maintaining his vehicle. As a result, Juan Evangelista can provide better service to his customers. This will increase his income level and help him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools for making repairs and maintaining his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed.

loans.name: Melier

texts.en:
Melier sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to buy additional ingredients and supplies needed in their ice cream business. The loan also helped her to provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve her business further if you help her to borrow an amount of 10,000 PHP. This new loan will pay for additional supplies like milk, milk powder, sugar, cream, butter and other things, which she needs to gain more profit. An increase in profit will also result in her business becoming more viable and sustainable, and simultaneously she will be able to pay for the needs of her family.

Melier hopes that her business will continue to flourish and become more successful. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients needed for her ice cream business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 55 years old and married with five children. Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, coffee, cereals, detergent soap, shampoo, chocolate drinks, canned goods, etc. 

Thelma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela, de 59 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos, que ya no dependen de ella, pero si les ayuda a mantener a sus nietos. 

Manuela, tiene un cafetín en donde vende pupusas, trabajo que ha desarrollado por más de 10 años. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar quesillo, harina, repollo, entre otros materiales que necesita para hacer las pupusas.

Ella sueña con ver a sus nietos graduados de una carrera universitaria, porque considera que solo así tendrán mejores oportunidades que las que ella tuvo.
texts.en:
59 year-old Manuela studied until the third grade; she is a single mother and has three children, who no longer depend on her financially, though she does help to take care of her grandchildren.

Manuela owns a small café where she sells "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas), which she has been doing for over 10 years.

She will use the loan to buy cottage cheese, flour and cabbage, among other items she needs to make the tortillas.

She dreams of seeing her grandchildren graduate from university, because she considers that this is the only way they will have better opportunities than those she had.

loans.use: to buy cottage cheese, flour, and cabbage, among other foods.

loans.name: Blanco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (Tatiana Dianiris, Loira y Daysi), todas pertenecen a la etnia miskita y viven en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan diario para generar ingresos desde sus pequeños negocios. Tatiana es dueña de una pulpería, Loira vende mariscos y Daysi vende bastimento en el mercado municipal. Con las pequeñas ganancias que obtuvieron en sus dos primeros préstamo lograron avanzar en sus propósitos, Loira pudo reparar parte de su casita donde habita. Están solicitando su segundo préstamo para continuar mejorando en sus negocios.

Daysi: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, originaria de Waspam Rio Coco, se trasladó a Bilwi en 1982 en el período que evacuaron a toda la población del Río Coco. Tiene 35 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 están en edad escolar y van a la escuela. Su esposo es albañil, pero no tiene un trabajo fijo. Ella apoya en la economía familiar con los ingresos que genera con la venta de mariscos. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar más productos de mariscos y pescados para vender e incrementar sus ingresos y poder asumir con menos presión los gastos de educación de sus hijos y resolver las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una tienda donde venda ropa, especialmente ropa usada que es lo que más demanda la población actualmente.
texts.en:
This solidarity group includes three women: Tatiana Dianiris, Loira, and Daysi. All of them are of the Miskito ethnic group and live in Bilwi, a town in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are enterprising women who strive each day to generate income from their small businesses. Tatiana is the owner of a grocery store, Loira sells seafood, and Daysi sells provisions at the municipal market. With the small amount of profit they earned as a result of their previous loan, they were able to make progress with their goals. For example, Loira was able to repair part of her house. They are requesting their second loan so that they can continue improving their businesses.

Daysi is a member of this solidarity group. She is a friendly woman who is originally from Waspam Rio Coco. Daysi moved to Bilwi in 1982 during a time when the entire town of Rio Coco had to evacuate. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children. Three of them are attending school since they are at the appropriate age. Her husband is a bricklayer, but he does not have a permanent job. She contributes to the family finances with the income she generates from selling seafood. Daysi is requesting a loan so that she can buy more shellfish and fish that she can sell. This will increase her earnings, put less pressure on her to provide for children’s education, and take care of her basic household needs. Daysi dreams of having sufficient capital so that she can open a clothing store that specializes in used clothes since that is what’s currently in high demand in her town.

loans.use: to buy more shellfish and fish to sell.

loans.name: Sonia Germania

texts.es: Sonia es una señora de 50 años de edad, es madre soltera y su hija tiene12 años, ella se dedica desde hace 4 años a atender su tienda, Sonia tiene su negocio en la casa de su madre que se encuentra alejada de la ciudad pero si hace buenas ventas, ella necesita el crédito para comprar productos de tienda y surtir su mercancía, Sonia vive con hija que asiste a la escuela y con su hermana con quien trabaja en conjunto para salir adelante, Sonia aspira que mejore su negocio y por ende sus ingresos para que a su hi9ja le permita seguir estudiando y que llegue a ser una profesional.
texts.en: Sonia is a 50 year-old, single mother and her daughter is 12 years old; she has been making a living for the last 4 years working in her shop. Sonia keeps shop in her mother's house, which is far from the city, though it does generate good sales. She needs a loan to buy products for her shop and stock her merchandise. Sonia lives with her daughter who attends school, and her sister who works with her so that they can get ahead. Sonia aspires to improving her business, and ultimately her income so that her daughter might continue to study and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy products for her shop.

loans.name: Mirian Rosario

texts.es:
Mirian, de 47 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijas, que ya no dependen de ella.

Mirian, tiene un cafetín en la escuela de su comunidad desde hace más de 10 años, en donde una de sus hijas le ayuda, para atender a los alumnos.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar golosinas, gaseosas, pan, dulces, entre otros productos para su cafetín.

Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
47 year-old Mirian studied until second grade, she is a single mother and she has two daughters, who no longer depend on her financially.

Mirian has been running a café in her community's school for the last 10 years; one of her daughters helps her there to serve the students.

She will use the loan to buy sweets, soft drinks, bread and cakes, among other products for her café.

She dreams of seeing her children graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, bread and cakes, among other products for her café.

loans.name: Raul Ernesto

texts.es: Raul tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su hijo de 4 años de edad. Raul se gana la vida como pescador, oficio que le permite llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Raul desea reparar el techo y las paredes de su humilde vivienda, ya que con el tiempo se han deteriorado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, láminas y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar a su familia condiciones más seguras.
texts.en:
Raul is 25 years old and resides in his own home along with his wife and their four-year-old daughter. He earns his living as a fisherman, a trade that allows him to provide for the daily needs of his household.

Raul wants to repair the roof and the walls of his modest home, which have deteriorated over time. Therefore, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that he can invest in the purchase of cement, sand, metal sheets, and iron. He hopes to receive this loan so that he can provide safer conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, metal sheets, and iron so that he can whitewash the walls and repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Evelyn Guadalupe

texts.es: Evelyn de 25 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos una niña de 1 año de edad y un varón de 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años y que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Evelyn desea instalar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda ya que el piso de esta es de tierra lo que está causando enfermedades respiratorias a su familia sobre todo a su hijo de 1 año de edad, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo de piso, cemento y arena para instalar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda.
texts.en: Evelyn, 25 years old, lives in her own house with her 2 children, a girl who is 1 year old, and a 7-year-old boy. She is an enterprising woman who earns her living with her business selling clothing, work she has done for 3 years and which allows her to get her family ahead. Evelyn wants to install a brick floor in her house since the floor is dirt, which is causing respiratory illness in the family, above all for the 1-year-old child. So, she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in floor brick, cement, and sand to install a brick floor in her house.

loans.use: to invest in floor bricks, cement, and sand to install a brick floor in her house.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
Pastor, de 38 años de edad, no tiene ningún grado académico, está acompañado y su compañera de vida le ayuda con el ganado y en la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos, pero solo dos dependen de él. 

Pastor, siempre se ha dedicado al trabajo de la agricultura y la ganadería.

El, utilizará el préstamo para comprar más ganado y para sembrar.

El planea en un futuro, comprar más ganado y enseñar el trabajo a sus hijos para que sean personas trabajadoras y de bien.
texts.en:
Pastor, 38 years old, doesn’t have any schooling. He is married and his life partner helps him with the cattle and the farming. He has three children but only two depend on him. Pastor has always worked in agriculture and raising cattle.

He will use the loan to plant and to buy more cattle. He plans to buy more cattle in the future and to teach the job to his children so that they can be good, hardworking people.

loans.use: to plant and to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Virgilio, de 58 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está acompañado y su compañera de vida le ayuda con el trabajo agrícola, tiene 2 hijos, que aún viven con él. 

Virgilio, se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura y la ganadería. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar abono, veneno y fertilizantes para sembrar, con el pasto que quede después de la cosecha, dará alimentos a su ganado.

Virgilio, planea tener bastante ganado, para que su familia tenga una fuente segura de trabajo para mantener ingresos.
texts.en:
Virgilio is 58 years old and he studied until the 3rd grade at school. He has a life partner who helps him with his farming work and 2 children who still live with him.

For his entire life Virgilio has been making a living working in farming and livestock breeding.

He will use the loan to buy manure, poison and fertilizers for his seeds and he will use the grass which is left over from the harvest to feed his livestock.

Virgilio plans to have lots of livestock so his family can have a secure source of income.

loans.use: to buy manure, poison and fertilizers for his seeds.

loans.name: Los Suertudos 21 Group

texts.es:
El banco de emprendimiento LOS SUERTUDOS 21 compuesta por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón,  ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; venta de frutas,  venta de jugos, mecánica,  venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida y venta de verduras por este motivo solicitan un préstamo para ampliar sus negocios.
