She is a seller. Muyassar is an honest, cheerful, bright and communicative person. She is trading in shoes, textiles, kid’s wear and perfume. She has a great number of satisfied clients. She buys her products from Dushanbe, Khujand and Istarafshan.

She is planning to widen her business, so she needed to buy a new collection of goods for selling. Muyassar is asking for financial support to buy goods.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of goods for selling

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: In 2010, Gina learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it extends. She pursued a business focused on farming. She feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Gina has asked for another loan to pay for seedlings and compost, which will boost her farm income. Gina looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Blessey

texts.en:
Blessey is 31 years old and lives in Punta Miray, Baliangao. She is married and has four children.

Blessey has a "ukay-ukay" (used clothing and bags) business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this work.

She has requested a loan to buy stock for her business. Blessey has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Blessey hopes to have her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy additional ukay-ukay (used clothing & bags)

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of working to support her family.

Recently, Marina requested a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs in order to boost her income. Aside from her project of building additional pig pens, she has thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale and plans to take in swine production for her business expansion.

Someday Marina hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs

loans.name: Rolivie

texts.en:
Rolivie, age 46, is from Oroquieta City, Philippines. She is married and has four children. Rolivie joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. 

The co-op supported her by providing the capital to start her barbecue vending business, helping the family survive. Fortunately, her barbecue station is located in a populous neighborhood, so she makes promising sales every day. Rolivie keeps on running the business well, even though there is increased competition from another eatery. She believes that with the support of her family, they will keep going and beat the competition. 

Rolivie wishes to have safe and comfortable living quarters, with a house constructed with a durable ceiling and walls. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional construction materials, like bags of cement and floor tiles, for the completion of her house. Rolivie wants nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional construction materials, like bags of cement and floor tiles, for the completion of her house.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 42 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children.

Thelma has a snack vending business and earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work.

She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business. Thelma has been a member of PMPC since 2005.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for a snack vending business

loans.name: Nellwayne

texts.en:
Nellwayne is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years old and is single. He has been engaged in a sari-sari store business for almost 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In June 2013, Nellwayne joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Nellwayne is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and will be used as working capital.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and have working capital.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
42-year-old Solomon is a youthful farmer from the Kitale area of Kenya. He was born and raised in the countryside where he learnt about farming alongside his father. Thanks to this, nowadays he has dairy cows and a maize plantation, whose harvest is sold, and this is how he obtains the resources to bring food into his home.

The borrower is a man who is thriving; he is a fighter and is devoted to his family and his work, which motivates him to work long days and try to get ahead. Every day he fights to overcome the obstacles that are in his way; he has been through difficult financial situations due to the low price of maize on the market, which affects the price of his product.

Solomon is kindly asking Kiva lenders for a loan to invest in the purchase of farming supplies (manure, fertilizers, pesticides) in order to keep his business going and prepare his crops to harvest a high-quality product. Solomon dreams of improving his crops and expanding them to obtain a good monthly income.

Help this hero who always strives to provide the best for his family and children.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of farming supplies (manure, fertilizers, pesticides)

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia has mastered her hog raising business in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to obtain credit to fully support her business. Just as how she takes care her hog raising business, it is so with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always apply for financing needs. 

Now, the loan of 40,000 PHP will help her build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build a pig pen.

loans.name: Cheery

texts.en:
Cheery makes a living through selling farm supplies. She runs a retail shop for farm supplies in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, and earns a promising income to support her family. 

She has signed up her membership with Paglaum MPC to gain access to capital. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she has requested a loan to purchase additional inventory to use as working capital to buy farm supplies for resale. Cheery hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of feed.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia has mastered her hog-raising business in Bonifacio. This is how she supported her husband in earning a living and she is able to support their family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. 

When she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. Virginia will take care of her membership with PMPC like she does with her hog-raising business. She wants to maintain her membership in good-standing, so she can always run to PMPC for any financing needs. 

Now, the loan of PHP 10,000 will help her build a concrete pigpen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build a concrete pigpen.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is 65 years old and resides at Tudela, Mis. Occ. He is a widower and blessed with 4 children. He joined PMPC in 2007 in order to access the programs and services of the co-op.

Recently, he's accessing his second loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 for additional working capital for his existing business; he is selling a variety of food products in the local community. He will use it to buy a variety of commodities.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities to sell in the local community.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 38 years old. She is married and the family lives in Tangub, Philippines.

Merlinda manages her fishing business and owns a fishing boat. Merlinda personally sells the catch from her fishing boat to the market and neighboring towns. She earns a good income each month doing this type of work. She is able to support the needs of her family, especially her childrens' health needs and education. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase new fishing equipment and accessories.

In the future, Merlinda hopes to buy another fishing boat to improve and expand her fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing equipment and accessories

loans.name: Urmat

texts.en:
Urmat is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Business Law. Here is his story:

“Education means a lot for me and my family. My parents have taught me the importance of education from my childhood, and it had a great influence on me as I was a diligent and smart student at school. Studying at American University of Central Asia provides a great opportunity to study at an international university with a diverse atmosphere, and to fulfill my professional and personal goals, which are to make a big contribution to the community.

I have a happy family with warm feelings toward each other, and there are six of us: my parents, me, my two younger brothers and a little sister. My father is a driver and my mother is a laboratory worker at one of the local hospitals in my town. She gets around 133 USD per month, which isn’t enough for anything, but to pay for my brothers’ school and my sister’s kindergarten. As we live in Tokmok town, I take a bus to come to the university in Bishkek, which takes about an hour. It’s so uncomfortable to wake up so early in order to be at the first class at 8:00 am and use crowded public transportation; usually I have to stand, as there isn’t place for students.

AUCA serves as a bridge between my student life and my future career. For me, intention to succeed is more important than anything else. I am a hardworking and determined person, and I’m ready for a new jump of getting a degree at AUCA.I believe in my abilities and leadership skills, which I think will be a great asset to anything and a great motivation for other students. I thank Kiva lenders for their trust in me and for their generosity.”

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marta works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fattening goats. Marta is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Marta has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 46 years old and has six children. Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost 3 years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 14,900.00 for the purchase of new fishing nets.  

Felicidad personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages/traps. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so that she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices. In the future, Felicidad dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam is 59 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is a single woman who is blessed with one child. Meriam has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase cellophane wrappers, juice powder, etc for snack vending and the rest of the funds will assist in financing the education of her child. Meriam has been a member of PMPC since 2009.

loans.use: to purchase cellophane wrappers, juice powder, etc. for snack vending.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 38 years old and married. She is from Tangub, Philippines. Eva has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month. She has been doing this type of activity for 2 years. This is how she helped her husband in sustaining their needs. 

Eva wants to provide her family with a simple, yet comfortable living space for all of them. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for the repair of her house. Eva has recently became an active member of PMPC. Now, she is on her way to repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for house repair.

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky has started her small time business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she has made good sales, since she is the only store in their barangay. Recently she approached Paglaum for much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock the store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce.

loans.name: Manuchehr

texts.en:
Manuchehr is a brave man. He was born in 1997. He is living in a rural area. He is single. He is a student. He studies well and hard. His mother works as a teacher in a secondary school. She has not earned enough money for paying tuition for university. 

Manuchehr is an active and friendly student among course mates. Teachers are satisfied from his attendance and activity. He is responsible before his parents, because he will feed them in the future. Manuchehr wants to graduate with excellence and to have a good place of job. He is needing financial support to pay tuition for university.

loans.use: To pay tuition at university.

loans.name: Espie

texts.en: Espie is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen makes good earning on her farming activities in Oroquieta. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially because her cost of living increased when her children entered college. 

Helen approached Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to receive a loan to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticide. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticide.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna heads up for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply corn fertilizer, for which she has applied for a loan to the Cooperative. Lorna hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce.

loans.name: Josebel

texts.en: Josebel has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting and earning income as well. Josebel has supported her husband doing this type of work.  Like a farmer, Josebel has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Josebel hopes to purchase additional rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is 46 years old and married. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. For the past six years, Merlyn has been a farmer. She earns 4,000 PHP each month and signed up her membership with PMPC February 19, 2008. Merlyn is requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
From Cavite, Philippines, Elsa is married and has two children. She is employed in a garment factory, also in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Elsa works as a seamstress, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s dictates. She uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines as well as hand stitching hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Elsa is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason Elsa is asking for your assistance to help her circumvent loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from her paycheck. She is seeking a 15,000 PHP loan to pay for her children’s educational expenses.

Elsa hopes to give her children a good education. She looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force and equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Levita before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for the educational expenses of her children.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets, gasoline, etc. for her fishing business.

Merlita has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling purified water.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Constancia has requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 21 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Constancia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rose May

texts.en:
Rose May is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Rose May has a manicure and pedicure service business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials and nail polish to use for her manicure and pedicure services.

Rose May has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials and nail polish to be used for her manicure and pedicure services.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
The jovial and chubby face can deceive you that he is happy. Tucked away in the countryside near the Kapkatet, Litein area of Kenya is a jobless man who is now a farmer named Paul. He lives with his lovely family. He is a hardworking and truthful man; he is honest and faithful to what he does and what he says. 

“Kapkatet” in the local dialect means “valley.” In this valley are a people who, in their totality, constitute wrenching statistics. Hardcore poverty pervades every homestead. Yet, every day when you look beyond the numbers, you will see a sea of people: a sea of about 1,000 bright, vibrant, open faces, searching and yearning for the opportunity to live a life of dignity and respect. They have the conviction that it’s possible. They are like the bones in the “valley of dry bones” that required only a breath to spring back to life. 

Armed with this conviction, Paul has kept hope and has been toiling on his farm for the past 12 years. His primary sources of income have been milk, poultry and some “side hustles” he does to supplement the meager income he earns from farming. The Kapkatet area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a sea of people, but the mill keeps breaking down, preventing farmers from grinding their maize. Paul intends to change this and is requesting a loan to buy an electric posho mill, which will grind corn or maize into flour. 

Maize meal is very common in Kenya and is a staple food for many communities. Many Kenyan families consume the maize product “ugali“ (hard porridge) regularly. The market usually provides sifted flour, but the cost is higher because of the sifting and packaging. Cheaper flour can be obtained by milling the maize directly using a posho mill. 

Through this loan, Paul will be able to grind maize faster because he will use an electric posho mill. Cases of breakdown will be rare because electric posho mills are more reliable. This loan will assist Paul to permanently change his life and achieve his life mission of driving economic development and poverty alleviation in communities in arid and semi-arid areas. Profits from the posho mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan, which Paul promises to fully repay on time. In the next two years, Paul sees himself as a very established businessman who will be running more than one posho mill in his remote village. Paul patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy an electric posho mill

loans.name: Mydee

texts.en:
Mydee is 30 years old. She is married with three children, who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store and has been doing so for nine years.

Mydee has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items for selling, such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, and eggs. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock.

loans.name: Neddie

texts.en:
Neddie is 53 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is still in school, Neddie works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

Neddie has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Joaquin

texts.es: Pedro de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 25 años y comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Pedro is 62 years old and lives in his own house with his three children. He has been dedicated to growing corn and sorghum for 25 years. He sells is products in the different markets near his house. 

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, infestation controls, herbicides, etc. In this way, he will be able to have better earnings and better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, infestation controls, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Donald

texts.es: Donald de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Donald está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía, ya que le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas en estos últimos meses y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Donald is 33 years old and lives in his own house with his partner and their two children. He has been dedicated to growing corn and beans for many years. He sells his products around the area in which he lives. With what he earns from his sales, he succeeds in paying for his household expenses. 

Donald is requesting another loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, infestation controls, etc. and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph. His sales have been going well in the last few months, and this loan will allow him to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, infestation controls, etc. and to improve his land.

loans.name: Islom

texts.en:
Islom is a hardworking man. He was born in remote district. He is living in a village. He is married. He has two children. His wife is a housekeeper. 

For about ten years, he has been planting cucumbers and tomatoes. He has his own forcing pit. He likes his business. He is seeking a loan for the enlargement of his business. He is planning to plant additional cucumbers and tomato plants.

loans.use: To buy seeds, plant cucumber and tomatoes

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de preparacion de tortas,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de preparacion de tortas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para preparar la torta como huevos,mantequilla y harina.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This woman continues working in her business making cakes. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman. Her dream is to grow her business. 

She requests the loan to buy supplies to make cakes, such as eggs, butter, and flour.

She is happy with the loan and promises to comply with the repayments.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making cakes, such as eggs, butter, and flour.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia Celia se sigue dedicando al negocio de bazar, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora,el sueño de la socia es abrir otro bazar. La socia solicita el  credito para comprar adornos, peluches y regalos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Celia continues to work at her shop.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  Her dream is to open another shop.  She is requesting this loan to purchase decorations, stuffed animals, and gift items.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase decorations, stuffed animals, and gift items.

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La socia  Ubaldina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,la socia tiene un restaurant, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ubaldina continues to work selling food at her restaurant.  She is an enterprising woman who hopes that her business will help her children finish school.  Her dream is to have a large restaurant.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

She is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El socio Adrian se sigue dedicando al negocio de bazar y tambien el socio vende artesania,el socio es un hombre trabajador y por medio de este negocio quiere ampliar el negcoio de venta de artesania.El socio solicita el credito para comprar adornos y peluches.

El socio se siente agradecido  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Adrian continues working at his market stall and also sells handicrafts.  He is a hardworking man.  He hopes that his business will help him expand his business selling handicrafts.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase decorations and stuffed animals.

Adrian is happy with the loan and promises to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase decorations and stuffed animals.

loans.name: Maria Fabiola

texts.es:
Maria Fabiola tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, su población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, etc. su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio. Esta inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, con gran influencia en el negocio. Maria Fabiola espera tener mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona, esto le va a permitir tener mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Fabiola is 40 years old and single.  She lives with her family in a rural area in the Cayaltí district, located in the Chiclayo province and Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.  Life in this area goes by quietly and people work in farming, raising livestock, and commerce.

She works selling groceries, including milk, oil, rice, sugar, sodas, and other items.  Her business is located in her home.  She has more than ten years of experience with her business and has very good personal and business references.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise, including rice, sugar, oil, pasta, and other items to increase her stock.  This investment will help her improve her sales and have a big influence on her business.  Maria Fabiola hopes to have a better stock of products to meet the various needs, requirements, and tastes of the customers in her area.  This will allow her to have better income and therefore improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise, including rice, sugar, oil, and pasta, to increase her stock.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en: Marita makes good earning on her farming activities in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially as she will high costs of living when her children enter college. Marita approached Paglaum to loan an amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 42 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Editha is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Editha has been in pig fattening for 6 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from fishing. Vilma is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to  buy fish to sell.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past nineteen loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is thirty-nine years old and widowed with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Erna is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Erna has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns an additional income from food vending and working in a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, a husband and father of three children, is a mixed small-scale farmer based in the remote village of Kwanza, Kitale. He has been practicing agricultural business for the past nine years and has never looked back. For a living, Daniel sells milk and food products from his farm at the local market. He enjoys seeing clients coming back for more of his products and he really feels satisfied. 

Although Daniel has been making profits through farming, he has always wanted to do poultry farming. The main challenge he has encountered is a lack of funds to get his business off the ground. Daniel is seeking a loan to buy quality breeds of poultry. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Kitale. It is also a business that can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. Daniel does not worry too much about competition because the market for poultry products is good - chicken is a popular meal for many people and this can be seen if you visit any fast food joint. With this loan, Daniel is confident that his income will increase and this will allow a permanent change in his life. He plans to buy different breeds of broilers and layers and will be selling eggs and meat to the local market and other major markets in Kenya. He also plans to start breeding, which will help increase the number of poultry on his farm. 

Other than profits from selling eggs, poultry feathers, and poultry meat, Daniel will also benefit from using the poultry manure, which is an excellent source of nutrients for his farm. Through this loan, he will assure his large family of a secure future and improved living conditions. Daniel dreams of having a sustainable poultry business in the future with a good flow of customers, and of generating work. Help a young entrepreneur with a creative mind and big dreams!

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Ada Beatriz

texts.es:
Ada, con el financiamiento anterior mantiene el molino nixtamal en mejores condiciones y la tienda con mercadería que sus clientes solicitan, tiene nuevos clientes, su familia vive en un ambiente más cómodo y está adquiriendo más experiencia en la administración de créditos.
Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar granos básicos para vender en la tienda y le dará mantenimiento al molino nixtamal, se mantendrá trabajando por una larga temporada.
texts.en:
Ada, with her previous loan, maintains her nixtamal grinder in good condition, and keeps her store filled with the merchandise that her customers ask for. She has new customers, her family is living more comfortably, and she is gaining more experience in loan administration. 

She is asking for a new credit to buy basic grains to sell in the store, which will generate funds to maintain her nixtamal grinder and sustain her work for a long period of time.

loans.use: to buy basic grains to sell in her store, giving her funds to maintain her nixtamal grinder and sustain her work for a long period of time.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, to pay workers and to rent land.

loans.name: Manuel Concepcion

texts.es:
El socio  Manuel Concepcion se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, el socio es un hombre trabajador que por medio de este negocio el socio quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño del socio es tener un restaurant grande. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Manuel Concepcion continues working at his business selling food.  He is a hardworking man.  He hopes this business will help him ensure that his children finish school.  His dream is to have a large restaurant.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

He is grateful for this loan and promises to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD –CCACHIMAYO,la socia  Maria Luisa, la socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de compra y venta de quesos ,la socia continua vendiendo sus quesos a todos sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia continua llevando sus quesos a Machupicchu,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder continua trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de quesos.
La socia se compromete a hacer sus pagos en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This client belongs to the communal bank SOLIDARIDAD - CACHIMAYO (Cachimayo Solidarity). Her name is Maria Luisa. She continues working in the business of purchasing and selling cheeses. She continues selling cheeses to all of the clients who request this product from her. She is still bringing her cheeses to Machupicchu. Maria Luisa is a responsible and persevering person. She wants to continue working in in order to support her family. She requests this loan to purchase cheeses. She promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase cheeses.

loans.name: Dora Angelica

texts.es:
La socia Dora Angelica se sigue dedicando al negocio de brosteria, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora,el sueño de la socia es tener otro negocio de brosteria. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar pollo y papas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Dora Angelica continues working selling roasted chicken. She is a very enterprising and hardworking woman, and her dream is to open another roasted chicken business. She asks for this credit to buy products to cook chicken and french fries.

Dora Angelica is very thankful for the loan, and promises to comply with the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking chicken and french fries.

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma is 50 years old and has ten children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming and selling rice in the Philippines. Welma requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Welma has been farming and selling rice for ten years now and has borrowed 36 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 39 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Basher

texts.en:
Basher is a 40-year-old married father of three children, living with his family in a rented house in Sana'a city, Yemen. He works as a taxi driver with a limited income. 

Over time, he purchased a piece of land and started building his own house on it. Unfortunately, that house is not completed and still needs to have a lot of construction and renovations done. Basher is working hard to finish it, but he doesn't have sufficient money to do it. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials to finish building the house and to make necessary renovations.

Basher hopes to provide his family with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to complete the building of his house and to make necessary renovations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the clearing of the land and plan for the structure.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy and sell fish business. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Nyankhamba Group

texts.en:
Elina is 51 years old and married to a welder. She lives at Magawa village with her six children of which four go to school and two are young children. She sells maize by the side of the road to the nearest market. She is requesting this loan in order to buy more bags of maize to reach more customers in her village. Elina started her business to be able to feed her family and to be able pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to expand her business and start selling goods at wholesale when she has enough capital. In the future, she plans to build a better house for her family when she generates more profits. As a woman, she has improved her family living standards and she believes that the training she received on ‘Savings Culture’ will help her to achieve what she wants from her business

loans.use: to buy maize.

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en: Ang’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Ang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. 

Sophy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sreyneath's Group

texts.en:
Sreyneath’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. 

Sreyneath makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a responsible man. He was born in 1962. He is living in a rural area. He is married. He has one child. His wife is a housekeeper. 

He is a teacher. He has been teaching at secondary school since 1990. His family is not poor and not rich. His salary is spent only for the needs and expenditures of his family. To organize an event he is not able. 

Said is planning to have a party for his son. He is asking for financial support to organize the event.

loans.use: To organize an event

loans.name: Ocomisto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “OCOMISTO” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nicolasa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido y venta de mantas, producción y venta de leche, venta de chamarras deportivas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nicolasa es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió desde niña, mediante sus padres quienes trabajaban con este negocio; con el pasar del tiempo decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ternera) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente a la crianza  comercializará sus productos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen no esta adecuadamente ubicada una de las clientes, es por ello que no se la puede divisar carrectamente
texts.en:
The communal bank named “OCOMISTO” will initiate its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal of Los Andes. There are eight members and it is directed by an executive committee led by Nicolasa as the President.  The businesses of the members of the communal association are various, among them, knitting and sale of blankets, production and sale of milk, sale of sport jackets and sale of food.

The loan will benefit small business owners of this group which Nicolasa belongs to. It is her first year with the Pro Mujer group. She joined when she was invited by a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she owns a business selling milk.  She mentions that she learned this trade when she was a young girl with her parents who worked in this business. After some time she decided to start her own business.

The loan she is requesting is to increase capital to buy young calf. She will buy them from the wholesalers in her community and after raising them she will sell the products. This type of work will allow her to generate resources to financially support her family. She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services offered by the institution.

In the photo one of the clients is not located properly, that is the reason why it can’t be easily seen.

loans.use: to buy young calf.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Irene works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell ready-to-wear. Irene is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Burulsun

texts.ru: Бурулсун успешно погасила свой кредит. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Бурулсун на сегодняшний день имеется 6 коров, 55 овец и коз, 1 лошадь. На участке мерою 1,5 Га она с супругом  и детьми выращивает корма для скота. Ежемесячный доход составляет до  10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурулсун обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бурулсун планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Burulsun successfully paid off her previous loan. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who offered her financial support. She currently has six cows, 55 sheep and goats and one horse on her farm as well as 1.5 hectares of land where she grows livestock feed with the help of her husband and children. Her monthly income is up to 10,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Burulsun has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase sheep to increase her head count of livestock. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock and wants to save toward home renovations.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Mach’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, in Cambodia. 

Mach makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller, by selling groceries to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Nary’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, in Cambodia. 

Nary makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Guarani Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Guarani es un grupo nuevo, que está trabajando y se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con el cual podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello podrán mejorar su situación de pobreza.
La Sra. Lidia, se dedica a la venta de sabanas y cortinas, comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hacen pedidos de sus productos, y mediante ello tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y trabajadora, que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de cortinas y sabanas, de manera a poder seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe de poder seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
The group named “Guarani” is a new group. The members are working and striving to improve their living conditions. The group is also participating in the poverty elimination program so that the members can become familiar with their living status and make adjustments to improve their poverty situations.

Sra. Lidia sells bed sheets and curtains. She says that she has a good clientele who are always placing orders for her products. Through her work, she has the means to help her family and loved ones. She is a self-sacrificing and hardworking woman who wants to get ahead.

Lidia is requesting a loan in order to buy bed sheets and curtains so that she can keep growing her business. She is grateful for the assistance she has received so that she can continue improving.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets and curtains.

loans.name: Aimira

texts.ru: Аймира, 21 год, замужем, детей нет. Семья у Аймиры молодая, год они занимаются животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 дойные коровы, теленок, 20 овец, 15 коз. Благодаря упорному труду, Аймира на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка. Доходы от кредита Аймира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Aimira is 21, married, and does not have children. Her family is young and they have only been raising livestock for one year. They have two dairy cows, a calf, and 15 goats. Thanks to her hard work, Aimira currently earns 15,000 som (KGS) per month. She applied for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to expand her business and purchase a bull calf. She plans to use the profits to invest in further developing her business.

loans.use: buy a bull calf for fattening and resale

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en: Mon’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Mon makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a village coordinator to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each group member to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva Lenders! Meet Stephen: young, honest, humble and a very hardworking person. He hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. Stephen is still young and has so much that he wants to achieve before hitting 40; that is why he is focused and dreaming of being successful. 

Stephen never got the chance to go to college because of a lack of money for fees, but this never killed the zeal that he had for succeeding, and he started farming five years ago on a small plot of farmland that he inherited from his parents. Through hard work he has managed to practice crop farming and animal farming, and has managed to take care of his parents and also take care of his basic needs. Stephen grows vegetables and fruits and keeps dairy cows as a source of income. 

Although Stephen has been making profits, he is challenged by timely delivery of products to the market. This has made his profits go down, because goods reach the market when they are not fresh and hence fetch lower prices. Stephen comes from an area that has poor feeder roads and this has been a major problem for him. That is why he is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, Stephen will be able to transport his farm produce to the market and deliver it in a timely manner, and hence it will fetch higher prices. Vegetables, fruits and milk are perishable products and they require quick delivery to the market, so this motorbike will be of so much help. Through timely delivery of his product, Stephen is sure of increased profits and this will translate to better living conditions and a secure future. 

Stephen is very ambitious and he is planning that once he has accumulated more profits, he will be able to go back to school. Through education he will be able to have a more secure future, because education is “the key to success.”

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport his produce to market

loans.name: Sungheang's Group

texts.en: Sungheang’s group members live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sungheang makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Saon's Group

texts.en: Saon’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Saon makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Santa Teresa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formo en Ciudad del Este, forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de pobreza de cada una y conforme a ello poder ir superándola.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Virginia, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que esta en un nivel de pobreza extrema que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo, sumado a la venta de frutas y verduras ha ido formando los ingresos para crecer en su microemprendimiento. Virginia es una mujer muy trabajadora que se está esforzando por cada día ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas y dar a sus clientes todo lo que piden. Es una persona muy sacrificada y emprendedora.
texts.en:
This group was established in Ciudad del Este and is participating in the poverty elimination program so that all of the members can become familiar with their poverty situation and take steps to overcome that obstacle.

One of the members is Sra. Virginia. Her survey results indicated that she is at a Stage 1 poverty level. This means that she is at an extreme level of poverty. As a result of her efforts and her work of selling fruits and vegetables, Virginia has been able to generate income needed to grow in her small business. She is a hardworking woman who strives each day to improve her living conditions.

Virginia is requesting a loan in order to buy fresh fruits and vegetables so that she can provide her customers with everything they ask. She is a self-sacrificing and enterprising individual.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Duon's Group

texts.en:
Duon’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, in Cambodia. Duon makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 55 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y su hijo en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica al comercio de frutas de estación como limas, plátanos, naranjas, entre otras, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El crédito solicitado será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de frutas como naranjas, manzanas, plátanos, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con lo cual Juan espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de frutas a sus clientes satisfaciendo de esta manera sus gustos y preferencias, lo que le generará mayores ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 55 years old and lives with his wife and child in their own home made of basic materials. They reside in a rural section of the District of Pucará in Jaén Province, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The residents engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade as their main business activities.

Juan sells seasonal fruits such as limes, bananas, oranges, and other produce. He has experience in this line of work and his established customers have given very good personal and work-related references on his behalf. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase a large quantity of fruit such as oranges, apples, bananas, and other produce so that he can increase the inventory of his business. With this loan, Juan hopes to offer a wider variety of fruits to his customers so that their tastes and preferences will be satisfied. With the higher profits he will earn, Juan will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of fruit such as oranges, apples, bananas, and other produce so that he can increase the inventory of his business.

loans.name: Neat's Group

texts.en: Neat’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Neat makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
"Agriculture is the best employment, because nobody can sack you. You can start from any level and there are so many forms of farming you can do," says Joel. Joel, aged 41 years, is a resident of Koibatek, a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya. He owns a small plot of inherited land on which he has been practicing mixed farming for more than 15 years. He grows a variety of crops and keeps dairy cows and poultry. 

The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family's expenses. He needs to improve his income level, and that is why he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Joel passionately loves dairy farming and as he likes to put it, “Dairy farming is close to my heart." He plans not to buy just an ordinary cow but to buy a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence improved living conditions. 

The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan and also towards the education of his children. He will also benefit from cow manure which will be used in increasing the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan he will also be able to build a biogas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has 3 children aged 22, 19, and 17. In 1990, Kadiatu established her dry pepper business. Her business is located in the city centre, and her main customers are women. 

Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy 40 bags of dry pepper. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase the bags of pepper she has in store. In the future, she plans to improve the business by adding bags of groundnut. She is always cheerful. 

She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of dry pepper for resale.

loans.name: Xaverine

texts.en:
Xaverine is 44 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 5 and 15 years. All of them go to school. Xaverine has farmed for 28 years. With the Kiva loan, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice. The profits from the harvest will be used to buy food for home consumption. 


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To grow rice

loans.name: Zhumagul

texts.ru: Жумагул, 62 года, вдова, есть сын. У Жумагул среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес в далеком 1985 году. Благодаря упорному труду Жумагул в хозяйстве имеется: 1 корова и 15 овец, а также есть земельный надел мерою 0,68 ГА, на котором она выращивает хлопчатник. Ее деятельность приносит до 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь ее семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства и увеличения доходов, Жумагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 15 овец. Доходы от кредита Жумагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Zhumagul is 62 years old, a widow, and has one son. Zhumagul has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming for many years. She started this business was back in 1995. Thanks to Zhumagul's hard work, she currently has 1 cow and 15 sheep on her farm. She also has a 0.68 hectare plot of land on which she grows cotton. This business brings in up to 12,000 som (KGS) per month. This amount is not enough for a decent life for her family. For the further development of her farm and the increase of her profits, Zhumagul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy 15 sheep. Zhumagul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her farm.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep.

loans.name: Elissa

texts.en:
Elissa is 33 years old. He is not married. He has farmed for 13 years and will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer to grow rice and to sell the rice. The profits from the harvest will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice crops

loans.name: Chozvo Group 3

texts.en:
Chozvo 3 are a proud group of 14 farmers who cultivate maize in Catandica, Mozambique. All group members were born and live in the Chozvo area. The group sells its crops at a fair price to Empresa de Comercialização Agricola Lda (ECA), a local agribusiness which both acts as a buyer and provides the farmers with quality farming inputs and technical advice. An investment by AgDevCo has allowed ECA to purchase a state-of-the-art maize mill, designed for use in rural areas, so it can process the farmers’ crop before selling it on. 

The group farms in total 15 hectares of land. All farming is done manually. The farmers require finance to purchase vital farming inputs - all of them purchase seed and some choose to also purchase fertilizer. Access to a group loan of 36,010 Meticais (1,090 USD) equates to an average of 2,572 Meticais (78 USD) per participant- enough for the farmers to purchase from ECA the inputs they vitally need. 

Farming conditions in the area are extremely tough with only intermittent rainfall. However, since becoming participants on the Chozvo scheme all the farmers report life becoming easier. They can afford good quality fertilizer, which is purchased from ECA. The farmers’ crops are also bought by ECA every week - they come to their farms so the participants do not need to walk long distances to find a market for their crops. Since ECA’s arrival into the community, and with access to funds to purchase the necessary inputs, the farmers have seen their yields and incomes increasing threefold. This is allowing them to invest in their farms, buy motorbikes and send their children to school.

loans.use: To pay for farming inputs to increase maize crops yields

loans.name: One By One Group

texts.en:
Cossy is a new member in the One by One group. She is a single mother with three children and she was inspired by the other members from other groups' progress in joining UGAFODE Microfinance Limited and decided to be a part of the group. 

She applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy beverages and hard liquor for sale to her customers in her bar business. She hopes this will help her expand it for the better and also increase her sales and profit. She and the group members thank UGAFODE for the job well done.

loans.use: To buy sodas, beer and spirits for sale in the bar

loans.name: Sokhim's Group

texts.en:
Sokhim’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokhim makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does work as a traditional clothes maker to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Khasifah

texts.en:
Kasifa is a married woman of 45 years old with six children who are 20, 18,15, 12, 10 and 8 years old. She lives in a rural area with her family and two of her children are still attending school. She deals in agriculture produce trading and agriculture. She works seven days a week and each day she works for 10 hours.

She started her business in 1982 with the aim of getting money to solve financial problems at home in the absence of her husband who was working some miles away from their home. She has acquired this loan in order to re-stock cereals such as corn millet and beans since people have just harvested, and are currently being sold at a good price.

Her clients are traders from surrounding towns and her dream is to enlarge her business to the level of wholesale but her biggest challenges are the lack of enough capital, poor weather conditions and price fluctuations for these goods. She is described as a hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy corn, millet and beans

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grain to resell

loans.name: Caliente Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras (Celsa, Ana María y Glenda) que se organizaron hace 6 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios de pulpería y venta de bastimento. Con el primer préstamo que recibieron de Kiva lograron incrementar el inventario de los productos que venden.

Celsa: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer alegre, con cualidades de líder, originaria de Waspam que se trasladó a Bilwi en el período que evacuaron a toda la población del Río Coco. Tiene 33 años de edad, casada con tres hijos adolescentes, que estudian su secundaria. Su esposo es albañil pero sin un trabajo fijo. Con el propósito de apoyar con los gastos del hogar y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 4 años estableció su pequeña pulpería donde vende productos básicos que demanda la población. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, jabón, detergentes, sopa instantánea, gaseosas, carbón, entre otros productos. Su sueño es ser una comerciante exitosa y tener un negocio próspero.
texts.en:
This group consists of three determined women (Celsa, Ana María, and Glenda) who joined together six months ago with the intent of accessing a loan so that they could improve their living conditions, cover basic household needs, secure their children’s education, and expand their businesses of selling groceries and provisions. With the first loan they received from Kiva, they were able to increase the inventory of products that they sell.

Celsa is the coordinator of this solidarity group. She is a cheerful woman who possesses leadership qualities. Celsa is originally from Waspam, but she moved to Bilwi during a period when the entire population of Río Coco had to evacuate. She is 33 years old, married, and has three teenage children who are in high school. Her husband is a bricklayer, but he does not have a permanent job. With the intent of contributing to the household expenses, she decided to have her own source of income. Four years ago, she opened a small store where she sells basic products that people demand.

Celsa is requesting a loan in order to buy basic grains, soap, detergents, instant soups, sodas, charcoal, and other products. Her dream is to become a successful merchant and have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soap, detergents, instant soups, sodas, charcoal, and other products.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province, in Cambodia. 

Sophy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
18 son las mujeres que se han unido en este grupo, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren ir creciendo y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ellas además forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con el cual podrán ir mejorándolo y trabajar por ello.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Reinalda quien en su encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza extremo. Ella comenta que entre el trabajo que ella hace se dedica a la costura, es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, es por eso que le va muy bien y tiene muy buena clientela. Su sueño es poder ir creciendo poco a poco para dar a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus costuras, ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
There are 18 women who have joined together to form this group. These women are the heads of their families and they want to strive and grow so that they can improve their living conditions. They are also participating in the poverty elimination program. By working with the program, they will be able to improve.

One of the members is Sra. Reinalda, whose survey results indicated that she is at an extreme poverty level. She says that she devotes herself to sewing as her work. Reinalda is a woman who is very good at what she does. For this reason, she is doing very well and has built up a good clientele. Her dream is grow little by little so that she provide her family with everything that she was not able to have.

Reinalda is requesting a loan so that she can invest in fabrics, thread, elastic, and other supplies in order to keep sewing. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastic, and other supplies.

loans.name: Andino Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ANDINO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Silvia Carolina ella es casada y tiene 50 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza.
