La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de internet, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The pictured members members belong to the “Andino” communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, pertaining to the province and department of Cusco.

The member [featured here] is Silvia Carolina, who is married, 50 years old, and has three children. Silvia works in her business selling beauty products, including lipstick, skin cream and perfume. She works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. By means of this business, Silvia hopes to advance her children. She has various years of experience and things are going well for her. Silvia's dream is to have a local shop where she can sell beauty products. Silvia is requesting a loan to purchase creams, lipsticks, and perfumes.

The remaining bank members are dedicated to businesses such as providing internet access, selling clothing, and operating a grocery store and a book store.

Silvia is grateful to all who become a part of her dream in this manner, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: purchase skin creams, lipsticks, and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Han, 40 years old, lives in a community of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has two children; one is a waiter and one is a garment factory worker. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for more than twenty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 4.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Juan Adder

texts.es:
Juan Adder tiene 21 años, es casado, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Zaña, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada principalmente al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la venta de productos de uso doméstico como ollas, platos, planchas, teteras, entre otros, realiza esta actividad en Zaña y en distritos cercanos, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como ollas, platos, planchas, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Juan Adder espera ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que le permitirá realizar más ventas, con lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Adder is 21 years old, married, and lives with his wife and child. They reside in the District of Zaña in Chiclayo Province, which is in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. The community where they live is known primarily for trade, agriculture, and livestock breeding.

Juan Adder sells household products such as pots, plates, griddles, teapots, and other items. He conducts his business in Zaña and in other districts nearby. Juan Adder has experience in this line of work and also has good personal and work-related references who are from the area. His current loan will be used to buy a large quantity of products such as pots, plates, griddles, and other items so that he can increase the inventory of his business. With this loan, Juan Adder hopes to offer a wider variety of products to his customers. This will help him make more sales, which will increase his income level and eventually improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy pots, plates, griddles, and other items so that he can increase the inventory of his business.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan lives on a hilltop in Litein, Kenya, with his wife and their children. From his small, but immaculately clean mud house, he can see a lush valley full of maize, tomatoes, beans, and vegetables. He can also see a bright future, thanks to the income he earns through practicing mixed farming. 

Jonathan passionately loves dairy farming and has nicknamed one of his cows. Because of his immense farming knowledge, he has turned his farmland into an open university. Here, hundreds turn up to get trained in the hope that they will replicate his model in their own farmland. 

However, the biggest challenge he faces is satisfying the demand for milk in his village. The demand is overwhelming. He is seeking a loan to buy another quality dairy cow. He believes that, through the loan, he will be able to improve his living conditions and be able to secure the future of his children. 

Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, he is confident that the skills he acquired will help him increase his business and pay back the loan. Jonathan is confident that if you invest in his dream, you will be impacting the life of his family and, especially, his children.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Letecia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business.

Letecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 60 years old and married with six children.

Violeta earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Violeta has been farming coconut for 30 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish for her business.

Maria has been in this business for five years. Maria earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina, vive con sus hijos, tiene la responsabilidad de cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, en su adolescencia ayudaba a su familia a desempeñar dicha actividad, al convertirse en el pilar de su propio hogar tomo el oficio como una fuente de ingresos, su negocio lo formalizo hace cinco años, trabaja de cuatro de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.
Está solicitando un financiamiento para poder comprar maíz, cal, leña, gas propano y hacer pequeñas reparaciones  a su vivienda, tendrá a su disposición materia prima para elaborar la venta de tortillas y dar comodidad a su familia, espera aumentar la productividad de su negocio y ganar nuevos clientes, de esta manera incrementara sus ingresos.
Sus sueños es ir reparando su vivienda poco a poco de esta forma ofrecer una vida digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Martina lives with her children and she is responsible for meeting the needs at home. During adolescence, she would help her family carry out these duties. When she became the foundation of her own home, she used the work as a source of income. Her business was formed five years ago and she works from 4:00 am until 4:00 pm.

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy corn, lime powder, wood, propane gas, and to make small repairs on her home. She will have raw materials at her disposal to make and sell tortillas and to give her family comfort. She hopes to increase the productivity of her business and to gain new customers, so she can increase her income.

Her dream is to repair her home little by little, to offer her family a decent life.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, wood, propane gas, and to pay for repairs on her home. She will have raw materials at her disposal to make and sell tortillas and to give her family comfort.

loans.name: Alicia Esperanza

texts.es:
Alicia, requiere un nuevo crédito por la facilidad de pago y apoyo que le brinda la institución, tendrá los recursos necesarios para comprar pipianes, mangos, sandias, pepinos, yuca, tomates, etc., su mercadería estará fresca para atraer a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le permitió surtir la venta de frutas y verduras para competir en el mercado, sus ingresos son mayores y estables, hasta la fecha ha cancelado algunas deudas y ya está mejorando el sistema económico familiar.
texts.en: Alicia needs a new loan. Given the comfortable payment schedule and support provided by the institution, she will have the necessary resources to buy squashes, mangoes, watermelons, cucumbers, cassava, tomatoes, etc., so that she will have fresh merchandise to attract her clients. The last loan allowed her to sell fruits and vegetables to compete in the market,  her earnings are greater and stable.  To date,  she has paid off some debts and she is improving her family economic system. .

loans.use: To buy squashes, mangoes, watermelons, cucumbers, cassava, tomatoes, etc. so that she will have fresh merchandise to attract her clients.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de cuadernos, lápices, crayolas, borradores, sacapuntas y otros artículos escolares, aprovechara la temporada de inicio de año escolar para obtener ingresos extras.
El financiamiento anterior le ha ayudado a mantener su negocio de venta de refrescos, boquitas, azúcar debidamente surtido, con esta inversión está generando más ingresos, las circunstancias familiares son más confortables y ha adquirido electrodomésticos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Diana is applying for a new loan to invest in the purchase of notebooks, pencils, crayons, erasers, sharpeners, and other school items. She will take advantage of the beginning of the school year in order to earn extra money.

The previous loan has helped her to maintain her business selling soft drinks, snacks, and assorted sweets. With this investment, she is generating more income, her family circumstances are more comfortable, and she has acquired appliances for her home.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, crayons, erasers, sharpeners, and other school items.  She will take advantage of the beginning of the school year in order to earn extra money.

loans.name: Zoila Leticia

texts.es:
Zoila, de 22 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora, que estudió hasta bachillerato, pues por la escases de recursos económicos de su familia, no logro seguir estudiando en la universidad, está soltera y vive junto a su madre y dos hermanos que actualmente se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.

Zoila, se dedica a vender frutas y verduras desde hace un tiempo, es una alternativa que le genera ingresos económicos a ella y su familia, ella tiene que cargar su mercadería para ir vendiendo en la calle, ya tiene ruta de venta y sus clientes la esperan para comprarle y hacerle pedidos de verduras o frutas. Antes de esta actividad ella tenía un trabajo fijo, trabajaba como cocinera en un telecentro, luego de esto decidió dedicarse a este nuevo trabajo, ella junto a su madre y sus hermanos la apoyan a vender y poder transportar la mercadería. Ella vende de lunes a sábado y las rutas las visita dos veces por semana, gracias a esto logrado mejores ingresos económicos para ella y su familia. 

El financiamiento del préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más verduras y frutas como maíz para hacer tamales, tomates, pepinos, chile y diversidad de frutas.- Esto se debe a que tiene amplia demanda de estos productos y también  porque ella desea surtir de productos su negocio y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y poder rotar sus ganancias en otros productos.

Zoila, nunca ha descartado la posibilidad de seguir estudiando en la universidad y graduarse en de licenciatura en contaduría pública, también desea tener un local amplio donde pueda tener su mercadería y en un futuro, poder construir su propia casa y tener su propia familia.
texts.en:
Zoila, 22 years of age, is a very hardworking young woman who studied through high school. Due to a scarcity of resources in her family, she was not able to continue studying in college. She is single and lives with her mother and two siblings, who are currently in school.

Zoila has made a living selling fruits and vegetables for some time. It is an alternative that brings in income for her and her family. She has to carry her merchandise to sell on the street. She has her sales route, and her customers wait for her to buy from her and to put in orders for fruits and vegetables.

Before having this business, she had a job working as a cook at a call center. Then she decided to focus on her new job. Her mother and siblings help her to sell and to transport her merchandise. She sells from Monday to Saturday, and she runs each route twice a week. Thanks to this, she has been able to earn a better income for herself and her family.

She will use the financing from this loan to buy more vegetables and fruits, such as corn to make tamales, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, and a variety of fruits. This is due to the fact that she has a large demand for these products, and also because she wants to stock her business, offer better service to her customers, and be able to rotate her spending to other products.

Zoila has never dismissed the possibility of continuing her studies in college and graduating with a degree in public accounting. She would also like to have a large store where she could sell her merchandise, and in the future, be able to build her own house and have her own family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits like corn to make tamales, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, and a variety of fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase necessary home appliances

loans.name: Lukongo's Group

texts.en:
Lukongo is 63 years old and has 10 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Lukongo has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Lukongo also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Lukongo's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Heng makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Heng and each of his fellow group members to safeguard the health of their respective families and save money on medical expenses and save time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en: Leap’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Leap makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for hhis family.

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en: Nan’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nan makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor and factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en: Him’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Him makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina  Mujeres Trabajadoras, están en el primer ciclo con 19 integrantes, estas mujeres deseosas de mejorar sus condiciones de vida trabajan de manera conjunta y haciendo las capacitaciones.
Entre ellas destacamos a la señora Nancy, quien trabaja de manera independiente, tiene su despensa donde ofrece todos los productos y artículos de las necesidades básicas del hogar y ahora con este préstamo quiere surtir su despensa, con todo tipo de productos, como ser: verduras, carne, frutas, panificados, bebidas, y otros, para poder tener una buena variedad de productos para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Trabajadoras and is in its first cycle.  There are 19 members.  These ladies want to improve their living conditions and work and train together.

Nancy is one of the members who works on her own and runs a store where she sells personal and household products.  She wants to stock her store with all types of products such as vegetables, meat, fruits, pastries, beverages, and other things so she can have a good variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ñepytyvo está en su ciclo número   4 del programa de comité de mujeres, son 25 mujeres que se unieron con el sueño de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Guillermina, quien pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, y otros, de manera a poder seguir trabajando.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que poco a poco se ha abierto camino y hoy día ya tiene una clientela bien formada, pero quiere poder seguir creciendo, todo esto con la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya, a través de sus capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The group named “Ñepytyvo” is in its fourth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. There are 25 women who have joined together with the dream of improving their living conditions and those of their families.

One of the members is Sra. Guillermina. She is requesting a loan in order to buy various supplies for making her dishes such as vegetables, meat, condiments, and other items so that she can keep working.

Guillermina is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is gradually making a path for herself. Today she has a well-established clientele, so she wants to continue growing. She will be able to accomplish all of this with the help and training provided by Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and other supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
El Sr. Mariano tiene 50 años, es carpintero tiene 28 años de antigüedad en el ramo conjuntamente con su esposa, ellos tienen 4 hijos, por quienes están esforzándose para poder darles todo lo que necesitan para una buena vida.
Actualmente tiene su carpintería en su casa en donde realiza trabajos sobre pedidos en donde el mismo manifiesta que tiene mucho trabajo y que mediante esto ayuda a su familia.
Este préstamo lo pide para poder comprar maderas de todo tipo, de manera a poder seguir con su producción en la carpintería, lo cual ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos por el volumen de pedidos que posee.-
texts.en:
Sr. Mariano is 50 years old. He is a carpenter with 28 years of experience in this trade. He and his wife work together. They have four children, so they strive to provide them with everything they need to have a good life.

Mariano currently has a carpentry shop in his home where he works based on the orders that he receives. He says that he has lots of work, so he has the help of his family.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy all types of wood. This will help to continue production in his carpentry shop. As a result, the loan will help to improve his earnings due to the volume of orders that he has at the moment.

loans.use: to buy various types of wood so that he can keep up with production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials for her business such as styrofoam balls, tulle, and fabrics to increase her business inventory.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Maria de 51 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro perimetral en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero no tiene suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su hijo puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Maria is a 51-year-old single mother who lives in her own home along with her son. She has been selling “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas) for several years. With the income she earns, she is able to stay ahead of the household expenses.

Maria wants to improve her home by building a security wall in the place that is shown in the photograph. However, she does not have sufficient capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, and also pay for labor. As a result, she and her son can live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, and also pay for labor in order to build a security wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy nails, paints, and wires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables, flour, cooking oil, sugar, sweets, soft drinks, etc., so she can make and sell pupusas from her kiosk in the community's school.

loans.name: Ernesto Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Ernesto, de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta el séptimo grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene cuatro hijos, de las edades de 15, 13, 10 y 7 años, los cuales estudian en la escuela.

Ernesto, tiene una amplia experiencia en la albañil, ya que desde hace 20 años se dedica a esta labor, es un trabajo en ocasiones complicado y pesado, pero aun así él sigue luchando para poder sacar adelante a su familia, este trabajo es rotativo, el horario de trabajo varía dependiendo que tan grande es la construcción a construir.- Aparte de esta actividad también, se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra  de granos básicos, como maíz y frijol siempre con el apoyo de sus hijos que le ayudan en los tiempos libres.

Ernesto utilizará el préstamo para comprar polín de hierro y 20 pliegos de lámina para reparar el techo de su vivienda, debido a que en tiempos de lluvia, el agua se filtra y entra a la casa, es por eso que desea repararlo, para poder tener más seguridad para él y su familia.

Ernesto, sueña con poder ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios, para que puedan superarse y tener una mejor vida, también desea seguir mejorando su vivienda, para poder ampliarla y así darle una vivienda digan a su familia y que todos puedan vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Ernesto, who is 48 years old,  only completed the 7th grade. He is married and his wife does the household chores. He has four children, who are 15, 13, 10, and 7 years of age. They attend school. 

Ernesto has extensive experience as a construction worker. He is being doing this for 20 years. Sometimes is a difficult and hard work, but he still struggles to support his family. This job is changeable. His schedule changes depending on how big is the project they are building.

Besides this occupation, he also works in agriculture. He cultivates basic grains such as corn and beans. His children help him on their spare time.

Ernesto will use the loan to buy iron beams and 20 metal sheets to repair the roof of his house. During the rainy season, water filters inside the house. That is why he wishes to repair it, so he and his family can be safer.

Ernesto dreams of helping his kids throughout school, so they can thrive and have a better life. He also wishes to improve his home, to make it bigger, and offer his family a decent home where they can all live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy iron beams and 20 metal sheets to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Baatyrbek

texts.ru: Баатырбек, 56 лет, женат, есть 2 детей. Образование у Баатырбека высшее, он работает на почте, также на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 5 коров. Баатырбек на участке мерою 0,3 Га он выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу для реализации. Его совокупная ежемесячная прибыль составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). Баатырбек обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 коров. Доходы от кредита позволят развить его бизнес и увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en: Baatyrbek is 56 years old, married, and has two children. He has a higher education and works at the post office. For the past 20 years, he has also been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming. He has 5 cows on his farm. Baatyrbek also has a 0.3 hectare plot of land on which he grows corn and wheat for sale. His cumulative average monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS). Baatyrbek turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan to buy four cows. The earnings from the loan will allow him to develop his business and increase the size of his herd.

loans.use: to purchase four cows for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Las Comerciantes De Utatlán 2 Group

texts.es:
Paulina es una mujer de 53 años, vive con sus dos hijos, pero los dos ya están casados, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá. 

Paulina (es la señora que aparece en medio en la fotografia) es una mujer que le gusta trabajar pues ella actualmente se dedica a la venta de comida, lleva 15 años con este trabajo, pues con esmero y dedicación ahora ya cuenta con dos  locales de venta,  de esta forma Paulina genera sus ingresos económicos,  la iniciativa de paulina de poner este negocio,  fue por ella trabajo varios años con una señora en su comunidad, ahora Paulina con los dos locales que tiene, necesita comprar más condimentos y verduras, para que cada local tenga productos suficientes para cocinar, esta es la razón por que ella solicita un prestamo para comprar todo lo necesario, la meta de ella es vender más para generar más ingresos y sobre todo ganancias. 
Porque uno de los sueños de Paulina es  comprar su propio terreno para construir su casa, ya que ella ahora vive alquilando casa, Paulina tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el prestamo.
texts.en:
Paulina is a 53-year-old woman. She lives with her two children, who are already married. They live in a community in Sololá. 

Paulina (she is the woman in the middle in the photograph) is a woman that likes to work. She currently makes a living selling food. She has had this job for 15 years, and with care and dedication she now has two sales locations. In this way Paulina makes her living. Paulina's initiative to start this business came from her working for many years with a woman in her community. Now Paulina, with her two locations, needs to purchase condiments and vegetables, so that each location has sufficient products to cook. This is the reason why she is applying for a loan to buy everything necessary. Her goal is to sell more in order to earn more money and especially to increase profits. One of Paulina's dreams is to buy her own land to build a house, since she now rents her home. Paulina has hopes of obtaining the loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments and vegetables

loans.name: Jose Julian

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 40’ años, padre de un pequeño y responsable de un terreo que su familia le dejo donde se dedica a la actividad de cría de ganado bovino en pocas palabras es un productor de leche.
Los cambios climáticos y la edad han acabado con la vida de algunos de sus animales, reduciendo drásticamente su cantidad producida lo que supone un déficit monetario pues el precio de venta de leche está muy bajo y con pocas vacas no es buen augurio.
Ante esta situación el señor José quiere solicitar un préstamo para ajustar para  la compra de terneros, el monto es justificado en el precio del ternero, las vacunas que debe comprar, la inseminación artificial y el cuido para alimentarlas.
texts.en:
Jose is 40 years old, the father of a child, and raises cattle on a piece of land that his family left him.  In short, he is a dairy producer.

The changes in climate and age has ended the lives of some of his animals, which has caused his production to reduce dramatically.  The price of milk is also very low, which has caused a financial deficit.  With few cows he is not very profitable.

Given this situation, Jose is asking for a loan to have enough money to buy land for a good price, some cows that he needs, artificial insemination for the cows, and feed.

loans.use: to buy land, cattle, and feed.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is grateful that she was granted a PHP 20,000 loan to buy various fruits and vegetables for her store. She is glad that through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like now to apply for a PHP 19,000 loan to buy large quantities of produce such as cabbage, carrots, lettuce, yams, onions, bananas and other fruit. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial help that will be given her. Her earnings from her store help fund her child's schooling and supports her family.

Miguela dreams of buying a small place at the town market to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for various fruits and vegetables to sell at her store.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
La Sra Bernarda tiene 53 años, está casada con el Sr. Ramón de 64 años, ella  junto con su esposo se dedica a la carnicería, compra animales y los faenan  en su casa, ya cuenta con su clientela formada y siempre tienen buen pedido.
Son una familia muy luchadora que se están esforzando por poder mejorar cada día y crecer. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de un animal que esta en oferta, que le redituara muy bien en poco tiempo y quiere aprovechar la oferta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en: Mrs. Bernarda is 53 years old. She is married to Mr. Ramon who is 64 years old. She and her husband work in a butcher shop, she buys animals and slaughters them in their house. She has a good clientele and always gets good orders. They are a hard working family who try very hard to improve every day and grow. She is asking for a loan to buy an animal on sale, which will pay off very well in a short time and she wants to take advantage of the offer. She is grateful for the opportunity she is getting.

loans.use: To purchase an animal for slaughter.

loans.name: Rosebel

texts.en:
Rosebel is from Cavite, Philippines. She and her husband have a child who is already in college. She has been employed in a garment factory in Cavite for three years through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Rosebel works as a seamstress. She does the sewing and designing of clothing/apparel according to the company's or client’s demand. She sews clothes using a sewing machine or other stitching machines, or often does hand stitching of edges and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Rosebel, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Rosebel is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative, and she had no problem in repaying them since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. She looks forward to your positive response, and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will also use the loan to pay for her family's personal needs and other expenses.

Rosebel hopes to give her family a good life. She attends fellowship meetings** to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before they start their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring, and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for personal needs and other expenses.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and works hard to support her family. She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Gloria has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her restaurant business.

Analyn has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from a general store.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 66 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. Josefa is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy seedlings, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

Josefa has been in this business for 20 years and also earns income from selling firewood and coconut fruit. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Замиры на сегодняшний день есть 2 коровы, 5 овец, на участке мерою 1,0 Га собственной и 2,0 Га арендованной земли Замира выращивает лук, кукурузу и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль Замиры составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Замира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией. Доходы от кредита Замира будет вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Zamira successfully paid back her previous loan, using it for its designated purpose. She is thankful to Kiva and to all those who help her finance her loan. Zamira currently has 2 cows and 5 sheep on her farm. She also owns a 1.0 hectare plot of land and rents a 2.0 hectare plot of land on which she grows onions, corns and clover for sale. Zamira's average monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her farm, Zamira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 150,000 som (KGS) to buy cows for fattening up and reselling. Zamira will invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She is also determined to save money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Kampala Group

texts.en:
Secilia is a businesswoman who runs two main businesses. She has been running a shop selling clothes and shoes for seven years now; she buys at wholesale from big suppliers and resells at retail. In order to help her business grow and make more income, she decided to find financial support from Tujijenge Tanzania, Kiva's partner.

She now has a cereal business where she purchases up to 30 tonnes of grains, beans or sunflower seeds and resells to small sellers. This type of business depends on which season cereals are available. She is really a hardworking woman. Her dream is to manage up to 90 tonnes of cereals per week. She is in her mid thirties and is married. 

Secilia works from 9:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. every working day and is able to make a very good monthly profit. This is her third credit cycle from Tujijenge. She has paid back all of her previous loans successfully. She used her previous loans to start the cereal business.

Previously, Secilia was sharing a lorry (cargo van) with another seller to transport her cereals from the purchasing area to the market. This was due to the small capital she had at the time. Her second loan assisted her a lot, and she was able to rent her own cargo van. Bad luck: The van which was transporting her stock of cereals got into an accident, so she lost part of her stock and now needs to recover.

She is requesting a loan that she will use to replenish her stock of cereals so that her business can grow. Secilia will share this loan with her group, Kampala, consisting of two women who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals for her business to resell.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia Gregoria se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de jugos, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere abrir una cafeteria. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar manzanas, naranjas y uvas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Gregoria continues to earn a living selling juice, this member is a hard working and entrepreneurial woman. Through this business she wants to open a café. She is asking for this loan to buy apples, oranges and grapes.
She is very happy about this loan and she is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges and grapes.

loans.name: Jowenda

texts.en:
Jowenda is 44 years old, married and works hard to help her husband earn additional income for the family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, and spices.

Jowenda has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from bamboo waiving.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Jowenda aspires to save money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, and spices.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Joseph, a hard-working, dedicated and honest 53-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of his family, with a wife and children, he farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Litein in the famous Rift valley region of Kenya. For the past 15 years, he has been practicing mixed farming. His primary sources of income are milk, eggs and crop selling. He also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income he earns through farming. Joseph passionately loves dairy farming. The biggest challenge he faces is feeding his cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. He is seeking a loan to buy another quality breed of dairy cow. He intends to buy not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be produce between 15 and 25 liters of milk a day. The selling price for milk is 40 KES per liter, and with this loan, he would make (USD) $11 per day. Before Joseph joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports smallholder farmers with technical and financial solutions, he considered dairy farming to be a mediocre fallback occupation that did not have any future promise for income generation. After training, Joseph now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into if you want to succeed. With the loan, Joseph will increase his income from milk selling and his cows will have more food to eat and never reject food. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows, and through this loan, Joseph will achieve this. An increase in income will allow Joseph to improve his living conditions and secure the future of his children. His dream is to continue improving his dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Joseph hopes his dreams would be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders provide him with credit support.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a bamboo waiving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more bamboo to weave for her business.

Meriam has been in this business for three years. Meriam earns additional income from raising pigs and running a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo for weaving

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina, who is 44 years old, is married, with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Angelina has a business selling fish in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Angelina has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is 44 years old and has six children. She is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Mary has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Mary also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Mary's Group will be able to receive a total of 15 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ernesto Jose

texts.es:
Ernesto encontró en la animación de eventos su trabajo soñado, desde hace tres años dejo de ser un locutor de radio para convertirse en organizador de eventos, el alquila equipos de música y luces, aparte se encarga de animar fiestas. Descubrió en este negocio un sustento para su familia, la que está formada por su esposa y sus tres hijos, los cuales son menores de cinco años. Este joven quien tuvo un duro comienzo para adquirir sus primeros equipos, hoy deposita en Kiva a través de MiCrédito sus esperanzas de hacer crecer su negocio y visualizarse más estable. 
Él solicita el crédito para comprar nuevos y modernos artículos de animación como luces, parlantes, cables, entre otros equipos que le aseguraran el desarrollo y la satisfacción de sus clientes. Este avance le abrirá nuevas oportunidades para expandir su negocio por toda la ciudad. Ernesto es un hombre lleno de ganas de superarse, en un futuro tiene como objetivo comprar un vehículo para hacer publicidad móvil y trasladar sus equipos de forma adecuada.
texts.en:
Ernesto is an event organizer, his dream job. Three years ago, he quit his job as a radio announcer to become an event organizer. Apart from renting out lights and music, Ernesto is also responsible for creating a party atmosphere.

Through this work, Ernesto has found a way to support his family, which is made up of his wife and three children. The kids are all under five years of age. 

Ernesto had a hard time getting his first pieces of equipment. Now, he puts his dream of creating a stable business in the hands of Kiva - via MiCrédito. Ernesto seeks a loan to buy new and modern pieces of party equipment: lights, speakers, cables and other equipment. This will ensure the development of the business and the satisfaction of his clients. This step forward will open up new opportunities to expand the business across the whole city. 

Ernesto is a man with every intention of improving himself, in the future he plans to buy a car in order to create mobile publicity and adequately move around his equipment.

loans.use: to buy lights, speakers, cables and other equipment

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Margaret will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar-powered light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Margaret plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

Margaret’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of four acres of land. They will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar-powered light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials and complete building his second floor.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos es un agricultor y criador de ganado de 29 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos y actualmente separado de su esposa, un difícil proceso que abarco gran parte de su tiempo y sus pensamientos, dejando descuidar un poco su actividad económica sumiso en todos los aspectos personales que conlleva un divorcio.
Como objetivo principal este hombre se ha trazado levantar su cultivo, levantar su cría de animales pues tiene dos hijos por los cuales luchar, darles una educación y una oportunidad que aspiren a un buen futuro.
Solicita un préstamo para levantar su cría de animales, adecuando cocheras, comprando cuido y terneras, la otra parte la invertirá en compra de abonos, semillas, y exterminadores de plagas.
texts.en: Carlos is a farmer and a cattle breeder of 29 years old.  He is a father of 2 children and he is currently separated from his wife, a difficult process which has used a lot of his time and his thoughts.  He has been neglecting the care of his financial situation submitting all his personal aspects to the divorce. As a main objective this man wants to grow his crops and breed his animals as he has 2 children for whom he must fight, to give them an education and an opportunity to aspire for a good future.  He is requesting this loan to breed his animals, acquire garages, to buy feed and calves, the other part of the investment will go towards buying compost, seeds and plague exterminators.

loans.use: to restart his business, he will acquire garages, he will buy feed, a calf, compost, seeds and plague exterminators.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 50 years old and married with four children, two in school. Editha works very hard to provide for her family.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, and beverages..

Editha has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, and beverages.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business.

Nerissa has been in this business for three years. Nerissa earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina, posee una tienda de productos básicos y ofrece el servicio de molino nixtamal, vive con una de sus nietas, sus hijos ya son mayores y totalmente independientes, a pesar de ser madre soltera con esfuerzos saco a su familia adelante y actualmente se dedica a su negocio para cubrir sus necesidades personales y la de su nieta, el oficio lo heredo de su familia, su negocio funciona hace 30 años, maneja un horario de 5:00 a.m. a 11:30 p.m.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar azúcar, sal, arroz, papel higiénico, jabón, lejía, bebidas y jugos, cubrirá las demandas de sus clientes, brindara un servicio de calidad y generara mejores ingresos, espera obtener beneficios con el crédito.
Los sueños de Ernestina son ampliar su negocio y hacer mejoras en su vivienda para dejar a su nieta bajo un techo seguro y con una fuente de ingresos establecida.
texts.en:
Ernestina has a store of basic products and she offers a corn milling service.  One of her granddaughters lives with her. Her children are grown and fully independent. Despite being a single mother, with much effort she has succeeded and currently makes a living at her business to meet the needs of herself and her granddaughter. The trade was inherited from her family and the business has operated for 30 years, from 5:00 a.m. to 11:30 p.m.

She will use this loan to buy sugar, salt, rice, toilet paper, soap, bleach, soft drinks and juice to meet the demands of her customers. She will provide a quality service and expects to generate more income from the loan.

Ernestina's dream is to expand her business and make improvements to her home so that her granddaughter will be under a secure roof and she will maintain an established source of income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, rice, toilet paper, soap, bleach, soft drinks, and juices to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Enriqueta works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fish vending. Enriqueta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Enriqueta has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials.

loans.name: Azizi Group

texts.en:
GRACE, is in her early 30s, is single, and has one child who is still at school.  She has been selling fruits and vegetable for ten years now.  She works from 5 A.M. to 8 P.M. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit per month.

This will be GRACE's 22nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to sell juice and water and now has concentrated on a food business. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is really happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva's support of her group, because every one can now support their families.  

She used the profit to pay school fees for her child, bought a TV set, a deck, a radio, a sofa set,  a plot of land, built her house, and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables.  She dreams of opening a food shop.  

GRACE will share this loan with her loan group "Azizi" which consist of eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto Carlos tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su esposa e hijos en casa propia en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural del distrito de Zaña, que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, la población se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y comercio como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vacas) y a la venta de leche que estas producen, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 02 años de experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno así como alimento para la crianza de los mismos. De esta manera Roberto Carlos espera hacer crecer más su negocio, lo que le permitirá obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos is 33 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in a small community in the rural part of Zaña, located in the Chiclayo province, within the Lambayaque region on the northern coast of Peru.  Life here is peaceful and the residents farm and raise livestock.  They are also merchants.

He raises and sells cattle and milk out of his home.  He has been doing this for more than two years and has steady customers who provide good personal and professional references for him.  He is asking for this loan to buy cattle and feed.  In this way Roberto Carlos hopes to grow his business, which will allow him to increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Smallholder farmers in Kenya, like Paul (pictured), continue to languish in poverty due to the unwillingness of formal financial institutions to set up shops in remote areas. They say the rural population is unevenly dispersed and the farmers make low incomes irregularly. Supported by Kiva, Juhudi Kilimo penetrates remote regions to finance agricultural assets and farm inputs to improve productivity and profitability of rural enterprises. In this case, Paul is seeking a loan of KES 35,000 to purchase potatoes and beans to grow and harvest on his farm. He will also use the money to buy pesticide to ensure that his crops are not attached by bugs affecting the farms in the area. Income from this venture will help Paul repay the loan, take care of his wife, and send his four children to school. Paul's family will be very grateful to Kiva lenders for their kind hearts. The loan helps Paul raise money to move his family forward.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, beans, and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro, de 25 años de edad, es un  joven muy trabajador, está estudiando segundo año de bachillerato los fines de semana y de lunes a viernes trabaja de jornalero en diferentes actividades, pues tiene que hacerlo para generar ingresos y poder cubrir los gastos de sus estudios, está soltero y vive junto a sus padres y tres hermanas menores.

Pedro, trabaja cortando café y también, como ayudante de albañil, entre otros oficios, desde pequeño ha tenido que trabajar para poder tener ingresos y aportar a su familia y para sus estudios. Aparte de esto también, se dedica a la agricultura, junto a su padre cultivan la tierra en época de invierno, sembrando maíz y frijol, esto les permite tener alimento durante cierto tiempo del año.

El financiamiento del préstamo lo utilizará para comprar 200 tejas y cambiar el techo de su casa, ya que con el tiempo se ha deteriorado y cuando llueve se moja y le entra agua a su casa; es por esta  razón, que hará este trabajo para la seguridad de su familia. 

Pedro, sueña con estudiar una carrera universitaria y tener su título, para tener mayores posibilidades de vida para toda su familia  y en un futuro poder casarse, tener su propia familia y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Pedro, of 25 years old, is a real hard-worker.  He is currently studying on weekends in his second year of college and from Monday to Friday he works as a laborer doing different activities, he has to do it to generate income to pay for the costs of his studies.  He is single and he lives with his parents and his three younger sisters.  Pedro works cutting coffee and also as an assistant bricklayer, among other trades.  

Since he was little he has had to work to have an income and help provide for his family and for his studies. Apart from this he also works as a farmer, together with his dad he works to farm land in the winter season, planting corn and beans.  This allows them to have produce during certain times of the years.  

The financing of this loan he will use to buy 200 tiles to change the roof of his house, as with time it has deteriorated and when it rains it gets wet and the water gets in their home.  It is for this reason that he will do this work; for the security of his family. Pedro dreams of studying a university profession and obtaining a diploma, to gain better possibilities in life for his whole family and in the future get married and have his own family and built his own home.

loans.use: to buy 200 tiles to change the roof of the house.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 34-year-old married mother of four children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Evelyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Introducing you to Joseph. Joseph is a 69-year-old honest, hard-working and ever-smiling father . He hails from Litein in Kenya, a tea-growing area where the staple food is “Mursik,” a mouth-watering delicacy prepared from milk. Joseph has been involved in farming for the past 5 years and he owns dairy cows that produce milk for sale. Besides his dairy cows, he also keeps poultry and when you visit his farm you will witness tea growing as well as a variety of vegetables.

Joseph has a passion for dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his cows, but all is not well for this humble man. He is facing the challenge of the lack of a proper dairy unit which is why he is seeking funds to construct a proper dairy unit. With your loan, he will be able to better manage his dairy farm and create more value. A better dairy unit will assist Joseph to save more money because his cows will never be sick and this will also boost his dairy's milk production. Through building a dairy unit with the loan, Joseph will be able to collect the cows' by-products, namely, cow dung and urine which can be sold or better yet used on his farm. With a dairy unit, he will be able to better feed his animals and collect by-products such as dung to generate biogas fuel, make organic fertilizer and plaster his mud hut.

The money that he will earn from the dairy unit will be reinvested back into the business to create growth. Joseph is a very ambitious man and he projects that through the loan he will have higher quality dairy cows and be able to permanently change his living conditions and secure his children's future.

loans.use: To construct a proper dairy unit for his cows

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar is a 37-year-old married mother of two kids who has worked as a hairdresser from her house for seven years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She works for ten hours every day. This has allowed her to generate sufficient resources to support her husband with household responsibilities and to fulfill the needs of her daughters.
Bahar wants to install running water in her beauty salon. For this reason she needs a loan of 1500 azn. Please support her.

loans.use: to install running water in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Aqil

texts.en:
Aqil is 28-year-old single man. He is a farmer and lives with his parents. He breeds calves and fattens them. Then he sells milk and dairy products. He has been working in this area for eight years and has a good experience and earns 100 AZN monthly.

Aqil loves his job very much. He likes to take care of calves and his mother helps him to make dairy products. To keep this small business he needs to install a water engine in the yard in order to take proper care of the calves and produce dairy products.

He applied for a 1000AZN loan in order to buy a small good water engine and pipes and install them. He wants to enlarge his business and increase his income in order to help his old parents and buy medicines for them.

loans.use: to buy a small water engine and pipes for his dairy business.

loans.name: Dina Maria

texts.es:
Dina Maria tiene 47 años de edad, es separada, vive junto a sus padres y 01 hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas preparadas en su distrito, esta actividad la realiza en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con clientela fija quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El presente crédito será utilizado para la compra de insumos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, carne, entre otros, para la elaboración de sus alimentos, con esto Dina Maria espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Dina Maria is 47 years old, separated and lives with her parents and her son in the district of Cayaltí, which is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.  She lives in a community that is dedicated to commerce, agriculture and livestock.  She works selling food and beverages in her district.  She works out of her home.  She has a lot of experience in this business and a loyal customer base who give her great personal and professional references.  

She plans to use this loan to purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, oil, meat, etc., to make her meals.  With this, Dina Maria hopes to provide better service to her customers so that she can increase her earnings and improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, oil, meat, etc. to make her meals.

loans.name: Shar-Iyya

texts.en: Shar-Iyya is 31 years old, married and has 5 children. She lives in Romarate, Aurora, ZDS. She has managed a sari-sari store business for one year. This sari-sari store is one source of income for her family with the help of her husband also working as CAFGU in their place. Shar-Iyya requested a loan amounting P 5,000 for the purpose of additional capital for her sari-sari store. She wants her family to have a good living condition.

loans.use: to gain additional capital for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has four children, all of whom attend school. Fatuma owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Fatuma has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her area.

With the loan of 30,000s KES, she wants to purchase tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Florinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Florinda requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Florinda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Florinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and iron beams to start building a house on the land they bought

loans.name: Kwesiima Group

texts.en:
Gerald is a group member and group executive of Kwesiima group.  He is 47 years old, and has seven (7) children aged: 20, 17, 15, 12, 9, 7, and 5 years.  He is married and lives in Kabowa with his wife and children.

He is a tailor and runs a clothes shop at Kabowa, a city in the outskirts, which he has been running for twenty (20) years. He decided to take the loan to increase the capital of the business, so that he can increase his sales and profit.

He has competitors dealing in the same kind of merchandise, as one of the major challenges, but with his experience in the business and with plans to expand it, he is determined to succeed.  

The client is the one with his hand raised up in the photo.

The seventh person at the extreme right is the UGAFODE credit officer in charge of the group.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
"Pictured above is Josephine, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to 3 children, known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Josephine joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Josephine plans to send her children to school.

Between the 11 farmers in Josephine's Group, a total of 8.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 1 solar light."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is married and the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor plumbing. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. She earns a living by running a stall were she sells vegetables to her neighbors and people who live in her town. She faces a challenge in the high cost of transportation to her place of work, and dreams of establishing and expanding a motorcycle transport business in the future. Mwanasha is requesting a loan for Kshs 25,000 which she will use to buy green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to resell.

loans.name: Ulviyya

texts.en:
Ulviyya is a 42-year-old woman She is married and has two daughters and two sons. Her husband is a pensioner and his pension doesn’t cover the family’s demands. She is a very kind woman and perfect mother. She earns 125 AZN monthly for the family, by keeping small calves and breeding them up for 22 years. She raises them, fattens and then sells the milk or meat. 

Ulviyya needs to take care of the animals properly. Every week she has to supply water by car for the calves, but she doesn't have enough money for this. She applied for 1,500 AZN loan in order to call a master to install a water engine and water tank. This will help her a lot.

loans.use: to call a master to install a water engine and water tank.

loans.name: Aloyce

texts.en:
Aloyce is 29 years old, married and has one child who is still a baby. Aloyce is a businessman who runs a general store selling varieties of products; rice, maize and baking flour, soft drinks, beers, beans, sweets and much more. He also provides Mpesa and Tigo pesa service, a telephone money transfer on the same place. He has been in this business for three years, working from 07am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair profit each month.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his third credit which he will use to start the business of Tigo pesa and Mpesa in another area. He used the previous credits to buy inventories for his shop. He received profit which he used to cover household expenses and invest back into his business. Aloyce has successfully paid back his previous loans. He will be accountable for paying back the new loan.

loans.use: to start his business of Tigo pesa and Mpesa (money exchange) in another area.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en: Kamel is 25 years old, single and lives in Gaza city. He works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a small income. In the recent conflict in Gaza, his home was destroyed and his whole family moved to a small rental house. Kamal is requesting a loan from FATEN which he will use to buy stones to rebuild a small room in his former home. By taking this loan, Kamal will be able to move back into the house with his family. In the photo, we see Kamal in front of the ruins of his house.

loans.use: to buy stones to rebuild a small room in his destroyed house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy toys for sale.

loans.name: Dúo San Antonio De Villa Lobos Group

texts.es:
Dúo San Antonio de Villa Lobos 
Este grupo está conformado por la señora Ericka de 26 años de edad, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de verduras, es un actividad que le a ayudado mucho en su vida personal y de su familia, en esta oportunidad ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de más productos para vender,(verduras) ya que sus clientes han aumentado y necesita mas capital para invertir.
texts.en: This group is made up of Ericka, 26 years old. She has worked for several years selling vegetables. It is an activity that has helped her a lot in her personal and family life. On this occasion, she is applying for this loan for the purchase of more products to sell (vegetables) since her clients have increased and she needs more capital to invest.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is 50 years old, married and lives in Montebello, Leyte. She earns a living through retail sales of rice to people who live in her area. Marissa has been in this business for more than two years and is requesting a loan to buy more rice to sell. This loan will help her attract more buyers to her store. In the future, Marissa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EL PROGRESO-MARANURA, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Gregoria tiene 62 años de edad y es soltera, la socia se dedica al cultivo de frutas como naranjas, plátanos entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dúa a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Gregoria, is a part of the "El Progreso-Maranura" communal bank.  The bank is located in the Maranura district in the La Convención province in the state of Cusco.  Gregoria is 62 years old and is single.  She works growing fruits such as oranges, plantains, and others.  She has worked in this field for many years and it has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it everyday.  

Gregory hopes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.  She is seeking a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  She is grateful for the loan and she is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a married woman with five children. She is 34 years old and four of her children are currently in school.

Rosario has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years and is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosario requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her stall. She would like to save enough to provide and secure for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a 45-year-old married woman and has six children, three of which are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Letecia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Letecia has been in this business for 18 years. 

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 47 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc..

Gina has been in this business for 1 year now. 

In the future, Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, and groceries.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 58 years old and married with three children. Josefina works very hard to provide for them.

Josefina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and groceries.

Josefina has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and groceries.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. Fatuma operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. 

She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Jamin

texts.en: Jamin has had to overcome a lot of adversity in his life. However, he has always had the strength to overcome hardship and move forward with his two lovely children. He is a small farmer based in Kitale, which is an agricultural center near famous Mount Elgon (17th highest in Arica). He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely wife, and for ten years they have raised dairy cattle and grown vegetables. They recently opened a small milling business to supplement the meager income they earn from farming. From Kiva lenders, Jamin is seeking a loan for KES 65,000 to grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, which is evident from steadily rising exports.
