It is against this backdrop that Jamin wants to turn his farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. This loan will not only increase his income, but also reduce his family's income vulnerability.

loans.use: to expand his horticulture business

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married woman and has five children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has owned a food stall business, selling to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients, hence perishable goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase corn, lime, firewood, propane and bags to continue making and selling tortillas.

loans.name: Maria Olinda

texts.es:
María, disfruta mucho del ambiente familiar que posee junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, hace más de 20 años decidió dedicarse a la crianza y comercialización de pollos, los ingresos que obtiene al practicar está actividad son utilizados para cubrir necesidades de su hogar, los pollos los vende vivos y en piezas, trabaja todos los días y el producto lo sale a vender al mercado municipal.
Ella utilizara el préstamo para comprar concentrado y vitaminas para mantener saludables los pollos, con el resto mejorara las instalaciones de la granja, así la producción de pollos incrementara, por lo tanto tendrá la oportunidad de expandir su mercado,  espera mejorar la situación financiera para salir adelante.
María aspira a seguir creciendo junto con su negocio, llegar a tener empleados para realizar un mejor trabajo y contribuir con la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María very much enjoys the family atmosphere that she has with her husband and two children. 

Twenty years ago Maria decided to begin raising and selling chickens, and the income she earns from this occupation is used to cover her household expenses. She sells the chickens both live and butchered. She works every day and she sells her product at the municipal market. She will use the money from the loan to buy feed and vitamins to keep the chickens healthy, and the rest of the money will be used to fix up the farm's facilities. This will help increase the production of chickens and allow her to expand her market. She hopes to improve her financial situation so she can get ahead.

Maria hopes to continue to grow along with her business, to have employees so she can do a better job, and to contribute to her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is 37-years-old married man from Samtredia district. He lives with his pensioned mother, school-aged daughter and son, and his wife, who works as a sales lady at the local store and generates 200 GEL monthly. Vasil is employed at the railway and gets a fixed salary about 400 GEL per month. The family finds it hard to become financial stable as the income is not enough to meet all their daily costs. Vasil needs financial support to start a business  and generate additional income for himself. 

After several unsuccessful attempts, Vasil applied for credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting poor people to start or re-start businesses. Vasil plans to purchase all necessary tools and start repairing phones. He will open a small workshop and will be able to generate additional income. 

The family's living conditions will significantly improve with the additional income, and the family will have enough income to access regular products available in the country’s capital market, when needed. 

Vasil awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase tools and start a phone repair service

loans.name: Shafaq

texts.en:
Shafaq is a 40-year-old gardener. She is married and has two sons. Her husband is a driver but the main source of income comes from gardening. Shafaq has been raising and selling seasonal fruits for 20 years. She is very experienced in this area but her monthly income is only 137AZN and it's not enough for a big family.

Shafaq keeps a small garden in the backyard and takes care of fruit trees properly. Gardening is very difficult because the region where she lives lacks water. Shafaq applied for a 1500AZN loan in order to install a small water tank and supply water every week. This will help her fruit trees grow properly and provide good harvest.

loans.use: to install a small water tank and supply water every week.

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.en:
Elitumbe, who is in her early 30’s, is married with one child who is grown up. She has been running a general store for five years now. She works from 6:30 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to restock rice, sugar, flour, big and small juice, cooking oil, juice from a company called Azam cola, and bought fresh milk and yogurt.  She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profits to pay school fees, shop rent, kept aside the loan repayment, and covered household expenses. 

She will use this loan to increase the shop inventory and to buy a freezer for keeping her milk before all of it is sold out. She dreams of buying a plot of land for future building. Elitumbe will share this loan with her loan group "Nuru" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the shop inventory and to buy a freezer for keeping her milk before all of it is sold out.

loans.name: Aqil

texts.en:
Aqil is a 24-year-old single man. Aqil lives with his parents in the Agdas region. He is independent, careful, responsible, and hard-working. He works as a taxi driver, work that he's been doing for the past two years. However, his salary from this business is not enough to cover his family's needs.

His dream is to see the construction of his house completed. It is for these reasons that Aqil is applying for a loan of 1100 azn for the installation of potable water in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry room of his house, for the well being of his family.

loans.use: to install potable water in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry room of his house

loans.name: Xatira

texts.en:
Xatira is 47 years old, married, and she has two sons. Xatira and her family are farmers. They own a greenhouse where different vegetables are cultivated. She is a very enthusiastic woman willing to improve her family’s condition. This requested loan of 1,200 AZN will help her to renovate the greenhouse, and to purchase seeds and fertilizer to fight against diseases. 

As this is Xatira 's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Aqroinvest CU. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who haven’t had access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. Xatira will be very grateful if lenders support her agribusiness.

loans.use: to renovate the greenhouse, and to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Parvona

texts.en:
Parvona is a conscientious woman. She was born in 1989. She lives in a rural area. She is married and she has a child. Her husband is a builder in a foreign country. She is a housekeeper. Parvona is a wise, merciful and generous person. It has been seven years already that her husband sends money through money orders. 

She wants to have better conditions of living. Parvona and her husband are planning to renovate their house. She is seeking for financial support to buy building materials for repairing their house. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing their house.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 40 years old, married, and has four children who are attending school. She and her spouse are farmers, planting and harvesting rice to sell. They also hire laborers who help them in their farming activities. Evangeline wanted to improve her crop production but had insufficient funds to buy farm inputs. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides and pay labor costs for farming. She hopes to gain good profits for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides and also pay labor costs for farming

loans.name: Khadijeh

texts.en:
Khadijeh is a 38-year-old, Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and four children. Khadijeh joins forces with her husband to gather enough money to be able to live properly. She is a homemade food producer, and at the same time a farmer. Actually, Khadijeh uses her own harvests for food production. 

Currently, with her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase seeds and agricultural tools, in addition to installing water canals that will ease her crop growing. In the future, she would like to expand her business, as any increase in profits will make a significant impact to each member of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and agricultural tools, and to install water canals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new clothes fashion for her shop.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for five years and earns a monthly net income of 4,000 PHP.

Marilyn is 48 years old, married and has four children. She is from Tangub, in the Philippines.

Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid her previous loans from PMPC. Recently, Marilyn requested a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more inventory for her store to increase stock.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store to increase stock.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita has chosen to live as a single woman in Tangub, Philippines. For a living, she engages in buying and selling firewood to the local community. Juanita has been doing this for 15 years.

Juanita hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house. Therefore, she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for house repair. Juanita is a new member of PMPC.

In the future, she hopes to save money for future emergencies. She wants nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for house repair

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 49-year-old married woman who has three children, one of which is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lucia has a welding shop business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a 16,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials needed for her business.

Lucia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials needed for her business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 45 years old, married and the father of three children who range in age from 7 to 15 years old. All of his children attend school.  Daniel has farmed for the past twenty years is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, which he will use to grow more of the beans that he sells. He will use the profits from this business to buy domestic animals such as goats.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer which he will use to grow beans to sell.

loans.name: Timvane Group

texts.en:
Annie is 64 years old and married to a farmer. She has seven children and four of her children go to school. Annie sells tomatoes and vegetables. She is applying for this loan to buy more tomatoes in order reach more customers in her village. Annie runs this business in order to find funds for supporting her family and for her to become financially stable. Annie has successfully repaid previous loans from Microloan Foundation.

Her ambition is to build a better house for her children and employ someone to assist her when she has enough capital. She believes that the training she received on business management offered by Microloan Foundation will help her to have what she needs in her life. Annie is now able to satisfy her family daily needs and she is self-reliant.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Irma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Irma, se dedica a elaborar y vender tortillas, el oficio lo aprendió con ayuda de su mamá, la tortillería la tiene hace 10 años y su horario es de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, en sus inicio solo procesaba 15 libras de maíz diarias, en la actualidad sus demandas han crecido y está procesando 50 libras de maíz al día, vive con su madre y dos hijos, es soltera, ha sido una persona luchadora y responsable con sus obligaciones.
Invertirá en maíz, cal, gas propano, leña y el transporte de la mercadería para elaborar la venta de tortillas, espera abastecer su negocio con lo necesario parar mejorar la competitividad de la tortillería, contar con clientes satisfechos y tener su fuente de ingresos. 
Sus proyectos son cancelar su deuda, cubrir las necesidades básicas  familiares y abrir otro punto de atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Irma works making and selling tortillas, a job she learned with the help of her mom. She has had the tortilla shop for the last 10 years and her schedule is from eight in the morning to five in the evening. In her beginnings, she only processed 15 pounds of corn a day. Currently, her demand has grown and she's processing 50 pounds a day. She lives with her mother and two children, is single. She has been a steadfast person and responsible with her obligations.

She will invest in corn, lime, propane gas, firewood and transport of the merchandise to make and sell tortillas. She hopes to stock her business with what's necessary to improve the competitiveness of the tortilla shop, to have satisfied customers and to have her source of income.

Her projects are to pay off her debt, cover the basic family necessities and open another point of attention for her customers.

loans.use: to invest in corn, lime, propane gas, firewood and transport of merchandise for making and selling tortillas.

loans.name: Pheminus's Group

texts.en:
"Pictured above is Pheminus, often described as an extremely friendly person. She is 39 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North Distric, Kenya. She is married and has 3 children.

Pheminus is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Pheminus says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Pheminus will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.5 acres."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Fahmi

texts.en:
Fahmi is a 38-year-old married man with two children, living with his family in a small house in Sana'a city, Yemen. He has a University education and is the sole breadwinner of his family. In the beginning, he started his business with a small shop in his area selling small items for his neighbors but the income from this humble business was very a small. He decided to change that shop to be a phone accessories store. He thinks this business will be very profitable if he has enough items to sell.

Fahmi has a small amount of money. But in truth, that amount of money is not enough to start his own business. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase many phones accessories and other items to start his own phone accessories store.
Fahmi hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase phones accessories and other items to start his own phone accessories store.

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en:
Khuraman is a 20-year-old married woman. Her husband is a master. He repairs broken furniture and other housgoods. They have one beautiful little daughter and they love her very much. Khuraman has been running a small product shop for 1 year and earns 150 AZN monthly. She sells bread, butter, sugar, sweets, gum, water, juice, rice, and other products.  

Khuraman wants to provide her daughter a good childhood and a good education in the future. The income from the small product shop doesn't cover the family's demands. She applied for 1000 AZN loan in order to purchase new products to increase the variety of her merchandise.  This will contribute to the family income. 

Let's help Khuraman and her family.

loans.use: to purchase new products to increase the variety of her shops merchandise

loans.name: Solidario Sembradoras De Sacatepequez Group

texts.es:
Solidario Sembradoras de Sacatepequez
Este solidario está formado por doña Odilia, ella tiene 55 años de edad y desde ya hace mas de 25 años que ella se dedica a la agricultura como siembra de ejote arveja y shuchini, y hortalizas en general, en sus parcelas ubicadas alrededor de San Mateo, y sus productos lo entrega en la cooperativa cuatro pinos de la localidad, ella está solicitando el préstamo para compra de semilla de shuchini y arveja así como fertilizante y insecticida y bactericida, su deseo es cosechar un buen producto ya que la cooperativa le exige calidad de producto, porque ellos lo exportan.
texts.en: This communal bank is organised by Odilia. She is 55 years old and she has made a living from agriculture for more than 25 years. She plants green beans, peas, zucchini, and other vegetables on her land located near San Mateo. She delivers her produce to a cooperative located miles away from the area. She is requesting the loan to buy zucchini seeds and pea seeds, as well as fertilisers, insecticides, and germicide. Her wish is to harvest good produce since the cooperative demands quality produce for export.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilisers for growing vegetables

loans.name: Telma Del Transito

texts.es: Telma de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee desde hace 15 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos que comercializa, adicional a la tienda tambien tiene una venta de comida, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería como: sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Telma is 57 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and son. For the past 15 years, she has had a small store located in her home. She has many customers due to the variety of products that she sells. In addition to the store, she also has a business selling food. With the money she makes from her work, she is able to get ahead. She is requesting a loan so she can buy more merchandise including soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, and sweet breads. In this way she will be able to make more money to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marco de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su esposa, el se dedica desde hace 25 años a la venta y reparación de llantas para vehículos su negocio esta cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante en los gastos de la casa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marco, 56 years old, lives in his own house with this mother and his wife.  For 25 years he has made a living selling and repairing tires for vehicles.  His business is near his house in a busy area, and he has a lot of customers.  With what he gets from his business, he is able to get ahead with household costs.  

He is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale tires to continue with his job and to be able to have better income.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale tires.

loans.name: Dúo Luz De San Antonio Group

texts.es: Dúo Luz de San Antonio.Este grupo está conformado por la señorita Iris Margot de 24 años de edad, ella es propietaria de un salón de belleza desde hace mucho tiempo, en esta oportunidad solicita un crédito para inversión en su salón ya que necesita comprar cosméticos Cremas, tintes, pintauñas, etc., espera que le puedan ayudar nuevamente ya que en el crédito anterior no cayó en mora.
texts.en: Dúo Luz de San Antonio Group was created by 24-year-old Iris Margot. She has been the owner of a beauty salon for a long time. On this occasion she is requesting a loan in order to invest in her salon, since she needs to buy cosmetics, creams, dyes, nail polish, and other things. She hopes you can help her again since she did not default on her repayments for her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 37-year-old single woman from Lebanon living with her father. Fourteen years ago, she became the owner of a mini market and sells daily and dairy products, vegetables, and fruits. She is a good retailer and is the main income source in her household. 

At this moment, Rania is awaiting to receive a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l as she has to supply her store with needed merchandise in order to augment her business sales and her revenues. Rania says that the additional revenue will enhance her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy needed merchandise for her store

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to buy additional ingredients and supplies needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve her business more if you will let her borrow an amount of 12,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings needed in her food business, and will increase her profits. An increase in profit will also result for her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Flora wants to have business expansion and save for the future of her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es:
Danilo tiene 34 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y dos hijos menores de edad, viven en casa propia de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de Pimpingos, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, realiza esta actividad en terreno propio, tiene experiencia en cultivo de café hace 10 años y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. También se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la cosecha, de esta manera Danilo espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Danilo is 34 years old. He has a stable family, consisting of his spouse and two underage children.  They live in their own house, built out of rustic materials, in the rural part of the district of Pimpingos, which is located in the province of Cutervo, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountain ranges of Peru. He lives in a small community, which mostly makes a living from agriculture and raising livestock.

He makes a living from agriculture. He grows coffee. He does this on his own land. He has ten years of experience in coffee growing, and he has very good personal and work-related references in the area. He also raises and sells cattle. He will use this loan to buy compost and fertilisers in order to maintain his coffee crops, as well as to hire labourers for the harvest. In this way, Danilo hopes to offer better-quality coffee to his clients, which will enable him to increase his revenue and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilisers for maintaining his coffee crops, and to hire labourers for the harvest

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Visionarias Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Visionarias
Puntarenas

El grupo se integra para realizar su segundo préstamo, cancelan el anterior invirtiendo en sus negocios, logrando una muy buena gestión de los créditos y un crecimiento en sus negocios, destacando el apoyo a la economía familiar y mejorar las condiciones de vida. Se organizan actividades de ventas de comidas y rifas, para fortalecer el trabajo e integración de las participantes, lo que ha traído una mejora las relaciones de las integrantes.

Son 4 familiares y 2 vecinas, se han dedicado al comercio, comidas y actividades de costura, generando ingresos al hogar, apoyando la economía familiar, han trabajado con capital propio y esperan tener la oportunidad de empezar a crecer con el apoyo de Fundación Mujer y KIVA.

Cada una aporta a su hogar y desarrolla un negocio que le genera ganancias, se han organizado  para realizar actividades, apoyarse entre ellas y generar ingresos adicionales para ahorrar y hacer de Mujeres  Visionarias una gran microempresa. Las compañeras se conocen coordinando las reuniones de una manera adecuada, llevan su libro de actas al día, y la junta directiva a desarrollado un buen trabajo, se da un cambio en la tesorera ya que la anterior tuvo que dejar el grupo por situaciones familiares. Se incorpora en este préstamo una nueva clienta.

 Actividades consolidadas en la comunidad, personas activas, puntuales y participativas. Entre ellas destaca la presidenta, Cintia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas en la comunidad de Fray Casiano,zona de altos indices de pobreza, localizado en la provincia de Puntarenas, en el Pacífico Central de Costa Rica, ella es una  mujer con deseos de superarse, se capacita y aprovecha las oportunidades para apoyar a sus compañeras y a su familia, mujer de escasos recursos, ha sacado adelante su hogar y con esta oportunidad desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia, vive con sus papás y hermanos y entre todos generan ingresos para el hogar. 
Ellas buscan desarrollarse integralmente, por lo que con este grupo desean participar en actividades comunales y regionales y esperan recibir el apoyo de Fundación Mujer para participar en ferias y otras actividades similares. Venta de ropa, zapatos, por catálogo, entre otros. Se va a invertir para la compra de mercadería y materiales para la elaboración de comidas.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Visionarias
Puntarenas

The group is together for their second loan.  They paid off the previous one investing in their businesses, achieving a very good credit management and a growth in their businesses, emphasizing the support of their family economy and improving their living conditions.  They organize food sales and raffles to strengthen the work and integrate the participants, which has improved the relationship of the members.

Four of them are family members and two are neighbors.  They make a living in trade, food, and sewing jobs, thereby generating household income and supporting the family economy.  They have worked with their own capital, and they hope to have the opportunity to begin to grow with the support of Funación Mujer (Women's Foundation) and Kiva.

Each one supports a home and develops a business that makes them a profit.  They have organized themselves to achieve their jobs, to support each other, and to generate additional income to save and to make Mujeres Visionarias (Visionary Women) a great micro-business.  The members know how to coordinate the meeting in an adequate manner.  They have a book of minutes, and the board director has developed a good job.  They have changed the treasurer since the previous one had to leave the group for family situations.  They have incorporated a new member in this loan.

They are consolidated in to the community, active people, punctual, and participatory.  Among them is the president, Cintia.  She makes a living making and selling foods in the community of Fray Casiano.  This is an area of high rates of poverty.  It is located in the province of Puntarenas, in the Central Pacific of Costa Rica.  She is a woman with desires to excel.  She is qualified and takes advantage of the opportunities to support her partners and her family.  A woman with limited resources, she has brought forth her family, and with this opportunity she wishes to improve her and her family's living conditions.  She lives with her parents and siblings, and all of them generate income for the home.

They are seeking to develop fully, which is why this group wants to participate in community and regional activities.  They hope to receive the support of the Fundación Mujer to participate in fairs and other similar activities selling clothing, shoes, by catalog, among others.  They are going to invest to buy the goods and materials for making food.

loans.use: To buy goods for commerce activities, clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Agnes's Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 40 years old and has seven children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Agnes is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by eight farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Agnes started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills.

Agnes’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 43 years old, from Rustavi. She lives with her husband and two children. The only source of income for the family is her husband's monthly salary, which is not enough to cover everyday costs. Mzia decided to start her own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. 

With the received credit, Mzia will begin a trading business. She will purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and will resell them with price markups. This will increase her income, and with increased income Mzia will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to begin trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto es un hombre soltero de 33 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Sololá. 
Rigoberto  es un muchacho que le gusta trabajar para prosperarse en la vida, para la generación de sus ingresos económicos, él desde hace 5 años trabaja como albañil, pues al pasar de los años él esta aprendió nuevas cosas en el trabajo,  y esto lo  obliga a comprar más herramientas de trabajo, para poder satisfacer las necesidades de las personas, pues el obstáculo de Rigoberto es que no cuenta con dinero para comprar lo que necesita, es por eso que él ha decido buscar un prestamo para poder realizar esta compra, ya con sus herramientas él sería un albañil más útil, y generaría más ganancias. 
Los sueños de Rigoberto es dedicarse más al trabajo y lo que aspira más adelante es trabajar como maestro de obra, y otro  sueño es comprar su propio terreno para construir su casa, ya que actualmente alquila casa.
texts.en: Rigoberto, a 33 year old single man, lives in the Sololá community with his parents and brothers.   He is a young man who likes to work to succeed in life.  To generate income, he has worked for five years as a builder and has learned new things at work.  This requires him to purchase more work tools to meet people’s needs. However, Rigoberto’s obstacle is that he doesn’t have the money to purchase what he needs.  For this reason, he has decided to seek a loan to make this purchase since he will be a more useful builder with his tools, and generate more earnings.  Rigoberto dreams of devoting himself more to work and working as a foreman in the future.  His other dream is to purchase land to build his home as he currently rents.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 50 years old, married and lives with her family at Solana. She plants and harvests rice to sell. Her income goes toward her family's expenses,  such as daily meals and bills at home. She also uses her profits as revolving capital for the next planting season. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming. 

She hopes to improve their farming practices so they will increase their crop harvests and can save additional revenue for the family's emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming

loans.name: Levie

texts.en: Levie is 37 years old, married, and has three children. Her family relies on income earned through a farming business. They plant and harvest rice to sell with the help of laborers. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming. She will also pay laborers who help her in the rice field and help improve crop growth and nutrition.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming

loans.name: Leomar

texts.en:
From Cavite, Philippines, Leomar is married and has children. He is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Leomar works as a tailor, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s requirements. He uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines as well as hand-stitching hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Leomar is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason Leomar is asking for your assistance to help him circumvent loan sharks. He has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from his paycheck. He is seeking a 10,000 PHP loan to pay for his children’s educational expenses.

Leomar wants for his children to complete their schooling and have a better future. He looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force and equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Levita before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay the educational needs of his two children.

loans.name: Kanzada

texts.ru: Канзада, 64 года, вдова, мать героиня 6 детей. У нее среднее образование, на протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Канзады на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы, 40 кур. Также на земельном наделе мерою 0,54 Га, Канзада выращивает кукурузу для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль Канзады составляет 15,000 сом (KGS), однако этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь Канзады и ее детей, а ей очень хочется иметь возможность помогать ее детям и внукам. Поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Канзада обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность начать строительство дома.
texts.en: Kanzada is 64 years old, a widow and a "hero mother" of six children. She has a secondary education. For the past several years, she has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming. Thanks to Kanzada's hard work, she currently has 2 cows and 40 chickens on her farm. She also has a 0.54 hectare plot of land on which she grows corn for sale. Kanzada's average monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). However, this amount is not enough for a decent quality of life for Kanzada and her family. She really would like the opportunity to help her children and her grandchildren. For the further development of her business, Kanzada turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle to fatten up and resell. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business so that she can have the chance to start building a house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten up and resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two hundred yards of one inch hose and to buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es:
Gerónimo, de 64 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es padre de cuatro hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad y viven a parte, en su casa solo vive su esposa y dos nietos. 

Gerónimo, se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura, actualmente todavía siembra maíz y frijol, cuando era joven, estuvo en el ejército por más de cinco años. Hoy en día su principal actividad, es la siembra de maíz y frijol, pues gracias a esto puede tener alimento para cierto tiempo del año para su familia, gracias a Dios, logro sacar buenas cosechas a pesar de que la sequía afecto sus cultivos.
 
El financiamiento del préstamo lo utilizará para comprar cuatro cuartones de 5 varas y 10 reglas para reparar el techo de su vivienda, ya que con el tiempo la madera y las reglas se han picado, con la ayuda del financiamiento, podrá reparar su techo y en la época de lluvia, no tendrá que estar sacando el agua que entra en su vivienda y su familia estará más protegida y segura. 

Gerónimo, siempre ha querido tener su vivienda bien bonita, también desea tener mejores cosechas en los años venideros , que sus nietos salgan adelante y que puedan estudiar mucho para que sean personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Gerónimo is 64 years old and studied up to Grade 2. He is married and his wife works doing housework. He is the father of 4 children all of them adults and living away from home. He lives in his house with his wife and 2 grandchildren.

Gerónimo has worked all his life in agriculture. Today he still grows corn and beans. When he was young he was in the military for more than 5 years. His main activity now is growing corn and beans as thanks to this he can have food for his family part of the year. Thanks to God he has had good harvests even with the drought affecting his crops.

He will use the loan to buy 4 - 14 ft long beams and 10 planks to repair the roof of his house as with time the wood has decayed. With the help of the loan he can repair his roof and not have to get rid of the water that comes into his house. His family will be more protected and secure.

Gerónimo has always wanted to have a pretty house. He also wants to have better harvests in the years to come and wants his grandchildren to get ahead and be able to study a lot so that they can become useful members of society.

loans.use: to buy 4 - 14 ft beams and 10 planks to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 60 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Aurora has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and finish preparing the land for planting.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristina is 46 years old now.

Cristina has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Cristina has been in this business for 6 years now. In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Asymbek

texts.ru: Асымбек, 64 года, женат, отец 4 детей. У Асымбека среднее образование, 14 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 2 дойные коровы и 2 бычка, 15 овец, также земельный надел мерою 2,20 ГА, где Асымбек выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Супруга с радостью помогает Асымбеку в ведении бизнеса. Есть все условия для содержания скота, он обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Асымбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет построить дом.
texts.en: Asymbek is 64 years old, married, and the father of four children.  He has a secondary education and he has been involved in agriculture for the past 14 years.  He currently owns two cows, two steers, 15 sheep, as well as 2.2 hectares of land on which he grows clover for domestic use on the farm.  His wife gladly helps him to run the farming business.  Asymbek has everything that he needs to keep livestock.  He is taking a loan of 75,000 som (KGS) from Bai Tushum Bank CJSC in order to buy three steers and increase his cattle headcount.  He is planning to use the earnings from his loan to further increase his number of farm animals and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase three steers to increase his livestock headcount.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa Anagil

texts.es:
Rosa, es casada, tiene un núcleo familiar compuesto por su esposo y dos hijos, todos comparten la vivienda, es sastre y vende cosméticos, además colabora con su esposo en las actividades de crianza de cerdos y cultivo de granos básicos; la sastrería la atiende sola desde hace 12 años, se preparó por medio de un curso en su comunidad que ella misma se costeó para superarse y tener una actividad productiva con la que apoyaría en los gastos familiares, actualmente tiene contrato vigente con el Ministerio de Educación para elaborar uniformes para las escuelas, su trabajo es de alta calidad y los entrega con puntualidad.
Invertirá en la compra de telas, botones, broches, zippers, hilos y agujas, son materiales que está necesitando para cumplir con la demanda de esta temporada, espera atraer nuevos clientes y no tener dificultades para mantenerse trabajando.
Sus sueños son tener una sastrería más grande, contratar personal para aumentar la productividad, tener equipo moderno para trabajar con más calidad y cambiar el estilo de vida famialir.
texts.en:
Rosa is married; her family unit consists of her husband and two children, all sharing a household. She is a tailor and sells cosmetics. Besides that, she also helps her husband with pig-raising and grain farming tasks. 

She has tended to the tailor shop by herself for 12 years. She trained through a community training course, which she paid for herself so that she would be able to get ahead and have a productive job to support her family expenses.  Presently, she has a contract with the Ministry of Education to make school uniforms. Her work is high quality and she turns it in punctually.

Rosa will invest in the purchase of fabric, buttons, pins, zippers, threads and needles; materials that she needs to meet the demand of this season. She hopes to attract new clients and have no difficulties carrying on working. 
Her dreams are to have a bigger tailor shop, hire staff to increase productivity, have modern equipment for better quality of work and thus change her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, buttons, pins, zippers, threads and needles, items needed to meet the demand of this season.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old and has 5 children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Jane is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Jane started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has learned a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Jane’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve more her business if you will let her borrow again the amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics which she resells. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through this assistance.

Soledad wants to have business expansion so that she will be able to provide for the educational needs of her children. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Mesiya-A Group

texts.en:
Rashidi is a father of two kids, one in school and another still small. He is married and 33 years old. Since 2005, he has had a business selling fabrics and clothes-making materials. He works from 7:00am to 9:00pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month.

From Tujijenge, Tanzania, this is his second credit request to be apportioned among the MESIYA-A, a two member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. He used the previous credit to buy fabrics and materials. Rashidi earned an extra income which he used to buy a plot of land, and covered school fees and household expenses. He has paid back his previous loan successfully, in full. In the coming years, he would like to build his own house.

He will invest his loan in buying fabrics and materials to resell.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and materials to resell.

loans.name: Ujumbe Group

texts.fr: La cliente H-Nakalonge est une commerçante, membre d’un groupe de crédits «Ujumbe », âgée de 44 ans, veuve, mère de 7 enfants  dont 5 scolarisés et 2 sont grands. Elle est vendeuse divers matériaux de construction sur la route secondaire de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 20 sacs de ciments et 1 sac de clous. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
H-Nakalonge is a shopkeeper and a member of Ujumbe Group. She is 44 years old, a widow, and the mother of seven children, five of whom attend school and two of whom are grown. H-Nakalonge sells various construction supplies along the town's secondary road. She is seeking a loan from Hekima to expand her business.

H-Nakalonge is going to purchase 20 bags of cement and one bag of nails. By doing so, she hopes to pay her children's school fees and feed her children. H-Nakalonge thanks Hekima for their support of businesswomen who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To purchase 20 bags of cement and one bag of nails.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a humble farmer who goes to work on his farm every morning. He is dedicated to his work. This man only thinks about going forward and delivering good products. Evans knows that many people consume his products, and because of this, every drop of sweat that comes from his forehead is the determination that he puts in so that his products are pure and of good quality. He is a progressive, smallholder, mixed-farmer in Kenya. He comes from the luxuriant, white highlands of Litein, an area known for tea production and dairy farming. 

Evans owns a fertile, two-acre piece of land in this lush region of Kenya. He keeps dairy cattle, and grows tea and maize. He gets a lot of support from his dear wife, Emmy. Being a father comes with lots of responsibility, and feeding his large family requires a lot of hard work, so Evans has to put in extra effort to take care of his family. Evans started farming just after finishing high school. Since he never advanced his education, and because of the high unemployment rate, he ventured into farming, and he has never regretted it because of the profits he has been making. 

Evans practices mixed farming, and is regarded as one of the most hardworking farmers in his village, because he is able to juggle raising dairy cows and also doing crop farming. Evans is a visionary and enterprising person, and has always wanted to do dairy farming in large scale. One of the challenges he has faced is lack of sufficient capital. That is why he is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya has seen an upsurge in growth, and milk prices in the recent past have skyrocketed. This has translated to increased earnings for farmers. Evans has already decided which dairy breed he requires and, because of his immense knowledge about preparing hay, his cows will have plenty of food and will produce more milk. Evans projects that the cow he acquires with this loan will be producing more than 10 liters a day. Because there is a ready market for milk, he does not worry too much about competition, and marketing the milk will not be a challenge. Evans will be selling it directly to the market, as well as to big dairy-processing firms, which will result in increased earnings. Additionally, Evans has planned that instead of selling the milk in its raw form, he will package the milk. This will also improve his income. Profits from selling milk will enable Evans to be very successful. He also plans that with his accumulated profits, he will be able to construct a biogas digester soon, to produce energy that he will use in cooking and other domestic chores. Through the loan Evans is confident that his life will be transformed and his dream of providing a secure future for his family and siblings will be achieved. Evans is relieved to know that his life can be secured through partners such as Kiva lenders who help small scale and aspiring men such as him.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jetina's Group

texts.en:
Jetina is 65 years old and has 9 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group, which is made up of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Jetina has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Jetina also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Jetina's Group will be able to receive a total of 5 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to cultivate a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nurbubu

texts.ru: Нурбубу, 50 лет, замужем, мать 3 дочерей. У Нурбубу высшее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она работает главным бухгалтером в государственном природном заповеднике, также уже 10 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве Нурбубу есть 1 корова и 13 овец. Благодаря упорному труду Нурбубу, ее деятельность приносит около 7,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, заработная плата Нурбубу около 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита позволят Нурбубу развить ее бизнес и дать образование ее дочерям.
texts.en: Nurbubu is 50 years old, married, and the mother of three daughters.  She is a college graduate.  She works as a chief accountant at a State Natural Reserve, a job which provides her family with its main source of income.  Nurbubu has also been involved in agriculture for the past ten years already: she currently owns one cow and 13 sheep.  Thanks to her very hard work, she now makes 7,000 som (KGS) per month from her farming activity, while her income from her job is about 12,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep.  The earnings from her loan will allow her to further develop her business and to pay for her daughters' education.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy additonnal clothes for sale

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a conscientious woman. She was born in 1979 and she lives in remote district. She is divorced and has one child.

Nargis is also a business woman. She is a farmer who keeps livestock to sell, and she also buys and sells cattle. She has been in this business for about two years.

She is hardworking, responsible, honest, cheerful, punctual and clever person. She is planning to widen the scope of her business activities; she wants improved living conditions.

She is seeking financial support to buy cattle for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 26-year-old, married, Lebanese woman living with her husband. Their present living expenses are costly and Hiyam states that they are barely meeting their needs.

She has been involved in the agricultural field since 2011 and her husband is a construction worker.

To improve her business and increase its productivity, Hiyam looks forward to borrowing a youth loan from Kiva Field Partner, Vitas s.a.l., with the aim of acquiring agricultural tools and supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.

Hiyam has many plans for expansion in the coming years and she is sure that Kiva will provide her with the necessary support to reach her goals.

loans.use: to acquire agricultural tools and supplies such as fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles le village de Warassala, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de charbon, de savon et de gâteau. 
Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leurs vingt septième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FANTA SAMA personne au milieu dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de gâteaux. Elle compte acheter de l’huile, du bicarbonate, du sucre et de la farine de blé chez les grossistes à Fana puis le transforme en gâteaux. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma Group is made up of married women who, on average, are 34 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Warassala, in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through familial, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The women of Sabougnouma Group are in food services, and the sale of charcoal, soap, and cakes. They are on their 27th group loan. With the goal of meeting enormous customer demand, the group has turned to Soro Yiriwaso. Fanta Sama, the middle woman standing in the photo, is illiterate and is currently selling cakes. She plans to purchase oil, baking soda (bicarbonate of soda), sugar, and wheat flour from the wholesalers in Fana, then make cakes. She sells [her cakes] retail for cash at the market to a mixed group of customers. She expects to see a monthly profit of 70,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To purchase cake-making ingredients.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is an experienced man. He was born in 1977 and is living in a rural area. He is married with five children and is a teacher in a school. Additionally, he is in the business of farming cattle.

Adham's family is poor, and he does not earn enough money to feed his big family. Last year he built a house from the profits gained through his business. Now he needs to finish his house’s renovation. Adham is planning on enlarging his business of keeping livestock to help him accomplish his plans for the house. He is now asking for financial support to buy additional cattle for keeping.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle.

loans.name: Sharafat

texts.ru: Шарафат успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Шарафат на сегодняшний день есть 3 коровы, 22 овцы. На участке мерою 1,20 Га она выращивает арбузы, хлопок, помидоры. Ежемесячный доход составляет 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шарафат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян и клеенки для парника, чтобы выращивать и продавать экологически чистые овощи. Доходы от кредита Шарафат планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение полеводческой деятельности, она хочет накопить на покупку необходимой в хозяйстве грузовой машины.
texts.en: Sharafat used her previous loan as intended and successfully paid it off.  She is thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her to get this financing.  She currently owns three cows and 22 sheep.  She also grows watermelons, cotton and tomatoes on 1.2 hectare of land.  She makes a monthly income of 30,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy seeds and a plastic sheet to be used in her greenhouse, in order to grow and sell organic vegetables.  Sharafat is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her farming activity and to save enough money to buy a much needed truck, to be used on the farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and a plastic sheet for her greenhouse, in which she grows organic vegetables.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She lives in the province of Leyte, Philippines. Mildred runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items to the people in her area. As of now, Mildred is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, condiments, bread and snack foods. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Mildred hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, condiments, bread and snack foods.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Mary who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to two children, known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Mary joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has learned a lot from farming trainings. With the profits from the coming harvest season, Mary plans to invest in a business.

Between the 10 farmers in Mary's Group, a total of six acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive one solar light.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some necessary equipment and beautician materials for her store.

loans.name: Mercy's Group

texts.en:
Mercy is 55 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing a group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Mercy has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Mercy also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as they will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Mercy's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
This is Zuhro. She lives in Mastchoh district with her family. She has been engaged in sewing for three years. She sews nationality dresses and makes embroidery decoration. This activity is the main source of the family’s income.

Zuhro has three children. They are 15, 19 and 21 years old. Her older son is studying at the university. He is a very clever boy. After graduating university, he is planning to start his job in a state enterprise.

In order to continue his studies, he must pay an annual contract. But unfortunately, they do not have enough money. For this reason, Zuhro is asking for a loan. Now this loan is very important to her. She believes in the bright future of her son and needs your support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a hardworking man. He was born in 1962. He lives in rural area. He is married. He has one son. He is a tractor driver. He is responsive, honest and a handsome man. He drives a tractor to make land better. Additionally he is a farmer and keeps cattle at home. He tries well and works hard. He is planting seeds and crops for gaining more profit. Hasan is planning to widen his activity next year. He needs financial support for buying seeds and to rent  land for planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds and rent land for planting.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Caleb a young farmer from Kiminini, a remote village in Kitale Kenya, who has defied the common thinking about most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. 

Caleb is happily married and together with his wife they are blessed with 3 boys and 1 girl. His primary source of income is milk and also he plants tomatoes on his farm. He has named his tomato farm “ever blazing farm”. He also engages in personal business and has been able to earn a handsome profit from the venture. Caleb practices agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge from the agricultural training he has been attending to broaden his skills. Although he earns handsome profits from farming, he faces one big challenge and that is high prices in fertilizers, seedlings and inputs. This is a result of the monopoly that is enjoyed by the only agro vet shop in his area.

Caleb is requesting a loan to start an agro vet shop. The Kiminini area has only one agro dealer who is catering to thousands of smallholder farmers who solely depend on him for agricultural inputs. The agro dealer has been making a killing from farmers by charging them extra amounts since he is the only agro dealer and enjoys a monopoly. Caleb wants to change this and seize the business opportunity and through your loan he will start an agro vet shop and tap into the potential agricultural market. Caleb will also help the smallholder farmers in his area who for a long time have been having a serious problem accessing affordable farm inputs. Through your loan, Caleb will change from the peasant farmer he is right now to a certified agro dealer who will be depended on by nearly 5,000 smallholder farmers in his area for inputs, knowledge and information about improved inputs. Through increased income from the loan he will improve his living conditions and his future plans are to purchase a truck which will be used to engage farmers in output marketing activities. Caleb believes that there is no doubt that youths like him can find rewarding employment in farming. He patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to start an agro vet shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, condiments, bread and snack foods.

loans.name: Ramila

texts.en: Ramila is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. Ramila lives in the province of Leyte, Philippines. Ramila runs a small sari-sari or retail store business, selling various goods and food items to the people in her place. She also earns an additional income through fish vending. Her husband is a carpenter. As of now, Ramila is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, condiments, bread and snack foods. This loan will enable her to improve her stocks thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Ramila hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, condiments, bread and snack foods.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is a 61-year-old married woman from Montebello, Leyte. She earns a living through her poultry business. She has been in the business for more than 10 years now. Adelaida is asking to take a loan to buy more chickens to raise. A loan will help Adelaida to improve her business, thus augmenting her profit and income.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She lives in the province of Leyte, Philippines.

Rhodora runs a small sari-sari or general store selling various goods and food items to the people in her area. She also earns additional income through hog raising.

As of now, Rhodora is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda & beverages, soap & toiletries, rice, condiments, bread, snack foods, and piglets to raise. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store.

In the future, Rhodora hope to make her business more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money to pay for her children's tuition.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda & beverages, soap & toiletries, rice, condiments, bread, snack foods, and piglets to raise

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is from Montebello, Leyte. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods ranging from foodstuffs and dry goods, animal food, and others. Myrna has been in the business for more than twenty years now.

Myrna is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, snack foods, condiments, and animal feed. This loan will enable her to improve her inventory, thus augmenting her sales and income.

In the future, Myrna hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, snack foods, condiments, and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a 10 ton expander which will help him with to complete the bodywork and painting of vehicles without greater effort.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Nadin

texts.en:
Nadin is a young girl; she is a member of a family of six. Her father is an employer at a small company, her elder brother is working as a mechanical laborer, and the other family members are still in school.

Nadin is a university student, majoring in special needs education. She has chosen this field because it is an effective field and it helps with community-building, because this segment of society should be given special attention.

She is planning to open a special education center to teach people how to deal and communicate with special needs people and spread awareness in society about the importance of this segment of the population.

But now she is seeking a loan to cover her study expenses in order to continue on her educational path.

loans.use: To cover the costs of her study expenses and to continue on her educational path

loans.name: Andre

texts.en:
Andre is 54 years old. He is married with 7 children aged between 15 and 32 years old. Three of his children attend school.

He has farmed for 40 years and will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizers for growing beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy cows and food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers in order to grow beans to sell.

loans.name: Jessica Carolina

texts.es: Carolina tiene 18 años de edad, ella vive con su madre y sus 4 hermanos, Carolina se encuentra estudiando la secundaria  a distancia los sabados ya que los demás días de la semana se dedica a trabajar de mesera en un restaurante y tambien se dedica a crianza de chanchos, el crédito lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos, y de este negocio ella aspira seguir teniendo ganancias y seguir trabajando para terminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Carolina is 18 years old. She lives with her mother and four siblings. She is studying in secondary school  remotely on Saturdays since the rest of the days she works as a waiter and also makes a living raising pigs. She needs the loan to invest it in the purchase of pigs, and with this business she aspires to continue making profits and working to finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Dawood

texts.en:
Dawood is a 34-year-old man. He is married and has four children. He started his practical life when he was 15 years old in a car body and polish garage. He had developed himself and opened his own garage.

Dawood now is seeking a loan to improve his garage, buy new equipment, and to do some maintenance work for his machines to develop and emphasize his working place and increase his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and do some maintenance work for his machines to develop and emphasize his garage.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 50 years old. He is married with two children aged between 12 and 30 years old. One child goes to school. He has farmed for 35 years.

He will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to grow beans and to sell the beans. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow beans and to sell the beans.

loans.name: Franci Yessenia

texts.es: Franci tiene 22 años de edad, son 3 años que se dedica a la crianza de chanchos ya que su medre es quien le enseña a esta actividad, Franci también se dedica a trabajar en cosecho en una plantación de flores, Franci solicita el crédito para comprar chanchos y aspira que le siga yendo bien y seguir trabajando para formar su futuro.
texts.en: Franci is 22 years old. For three years she has made a living raising pigs since her mother taught her this activity. Franci also works picking flowers in a flower field. Franci is applying for this loan to buy pigs. She aspires to continue doing well and continue working to form her future.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Sophia's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Sophia, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by thirteen farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to three children, and is known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Sophia joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program, she says that her life has improved, especially because she has learnt a lot from farming trainings. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Sophia plans to send her children to school.

Between the thirteen farmers in Sophia's Group, a total of 8.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her harvests of maize.

loans.name: Pamela's Group

texts.en:
Pamela is a 35-year-old, proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She is representing her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega North District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Pamela has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Pamela described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Pamela’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Vitalina

texts.es:
Vitalina, de 47 años de edad, estudio sexto grado, esta acompañada y es madre de 5 hijos, los cuales ya están casados, en su casa solo viven ellos con uno de sus hijos y una nieta que estudia sexto grado en la escuela de su comunidad.

Vitalina, se dedica al negocio de engordar pollos y venderlos, también tiene una pequeña tienda, mientras su esposo  trabaja en una cooperativa, ella cuida de su negocio y del ganado que tienen.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar concentrado para los pollos de engorde y para invertir en su tienda.

El sueño de Vitalina es, que su pequeña crianza de pollos crezca, para obtener más ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Vitalina is 47 years of age and studied through the sixth grade. She is married and the mother of five married children. One of her children and a grand daughter, who is in the sixth grade in the community school, live with Vitalina and her husband in their home. 

Vitalina earns money through her business of feeding chickens and selling them.  She also has a small store; while her husband works in a cooperative, she takes care of her business and the livestock that they own.
