She needs the loan to purchase chicken feed for her broiler chickens and to invest in her store.

Vitalina’s dream is to grow her small chicken business to obtain more profits and achieve a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for her broilers and to invest in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help in the cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Petronilla's Group

texts.en:
Petronilla is the group leader of her group in Kakamega North District, and she is representing 14 farmers, including herself. She is married and is a proud mother of three children. Petronilla joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for five years.

Like many other farmers, Petronilla decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to feed her family. She hopes that, by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to send her children to school.

Petronilla's Group will use the farming inputs accessed through this loan to cultivate a total of 6.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 2 solar lights, because some of the other farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package, even though Petronilla decided not to do so.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married with six children. All of her children go to school. She also takes care of her sister. The family lives in a rented house and has access to electricity and piped water. Christine's monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She has operated a retail food stall for the last five years, and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonal changes. 

Christine has applied for a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more stock, including bread, Blue Band (margarine), milk, and tea leaves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more stock.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She lives in the province of Leyte, Philippines.

Vilma runs a small sari-sari or general store selling various goods and food items to the people in her area; she has been doing so for more than five years now, and this is her source of income.

As of now, Vilma is asking for a loan to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda & beverages, soap & toiletries, rice, condiments, bread and snack foods. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers to her store.

In the future, Vilma hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda & beverages, soap & toiletries, rice, condiments, bread, and snack foods

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown-up children from Montebello, Leyte. She is engaged in a retail sales business selling various goods like cosmetics and clothing to the people in her area. This has been the source of her income for the past 30 years now.

Virginia is asking to borrow a loan to buy more stock of items such as slippers and sandals, clothes, cosmetics, and perfumes, among others. With these goods, she will be able to augment her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers.

In the future, Virginia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items such as slippers and sandals, clothes, cosmetics, and perfumes, among others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, condiments, bread, and snacks.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is 41 years old and has one child. Life is indeed hard. But, by the grace of God, she was able to raise her child well.

Charlyn owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their house. This is a place where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, 5-Php-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and other items. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price then she sells it per piece for a higher price in order to profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby, and the people in the community. She earns PHP 1,000 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Charlyn desires for her business to continue to flourish. She hopes that her family will always be happy, loving and compassionate to one another.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cement to renovate the house from the inside.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Imagine investing in a venture and reaping nothing at the end of the day. This is the sad story of Moses, a youthful 58-year-old Mzee (old man): a wise farmer whose neighbors and fellow farmers respect him as a mentor.

He farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills near Kitale, in the northern Rift Valley region of Kenya. Moses' farming experience dates back to 2000. Like many other farmers in the region, maize is a staple crop which he has been planting for as long as he can remember. With time, the fertility of his land has started to dwindle and whenever he plants maize the yields go down with each crop season.

Moses has also been affected with weeds: he recalls that, at some point, a strange but nice-looking weed which produced purple flowers emerged and started to slowly colonize his farm, causing his maize yields to decline even further. At one point he could not be assured that he would harvest anything at all. Moses' initial thought was that his farms had been bewitched, a notion that made him feel helpless.

Today, Moses is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy fertilizers, pesticides and good quality seeds. Through this loan, Moses is going to increase his crop production and this will translate to improved income level.

This loan will permanently change Moses' living standards and there is no doubt that he can find rewarding employment in farming.

Lenders: kindly lend to this hero who strives to provide a better future for both his family and siblings.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and good quality seeds

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen is 50 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group of 7 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Hellen has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Hellen also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours so that her children will be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Hellen's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to cultivate a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jose Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar, de 29 años de edad,  estudió hasta noveno grado de básica en la escuela, debido a que en esos tiempos, para poder estudiar el bachillerato tenía que pagar una mensualidad y él no tenía recursos económicos, para poder pagar sus estudios, fue así como decidió dejar los estudios y dedicarse a trabajar para poder, ayudar a su familia económicamente, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 7, 6 y 2 años, de los cuales 2 estudian en la escuela.

Oscar, trabaja de jornalero desde que era pequeño,  debido a la falta de recursos económicos no pudo especializarse en algún trabajo, es así como él se gana la vida, para sostener a su familia con el poco dinero que gana.- Su trabajo es rotativo y su horario de trabajo es igual.- Además, se dedica a la agricultura, en la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol.

Oscar, utilizará el préstamo para comprar 5 pliegos de lámina, 3 comederos, un royo de maya para reparar su pequeña  granja de pollos, debido a que con el tiempo se le ha deteriorado y en tiempo de lluvia el agua entra y se mojan los pollos.

Oscar, en un futuro poder ampliar más su casa, para poder darle a su familia un espacio más amplio, donde vivir y estar más cómodamente.- También, desea poder ayudar a sus hijos a estudiar, para que puedan desarrollarse mejor en la sociedad y poder tener una vida más cómoda.- Ampliar más su granja de pollos es otro de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Oscar, who is 29 years old, went to school through the ninth grade of basic education, since in those times, he had to pay a monthly fee to be able to study for a high school diploma, and he didn't have economic resources to be able to pay for his education. This was why he decided to leave school and dedicate himself to work to be able to help his family economically. He is married and his wife does the domestic tasks. He has three children, ages 7, 6, and 2, of whom two are in school.

Oscar has worked as a day laborer since he was young. Due to the lack of economic resources, he was not able to specialize in any work. This is how he earns a living to support his family with the little money that he earns. His work is rotating,  as are his work hours. In addition, he works in agriculture, raising basic grains such as corn and beans.

Oscar will use the loan to purchase 5 sheets of metal, 3 feeders, and a roll of netting to repair his little chicken farm, since with time it has deteriorated, and when it rains, water enters and gets the chickens wet.

In the future, Oscar wants to be able to expand his house more to give his family more space where they can live and be more comfortable. He also wants to be able to help his children go to school so that they can develop better in society and be able to have a more comfortable life. Further expanding his chicken farm is another of his dreams.

loans.use: to buy 5 sheets of metal, 3 feeders, and a roll of netting to repair his little chicken farm

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of a country. She is married. She has two children. She has a year of experience of doing a business. She buys and sells dairy products. 

She was a participant of a course, “To Get Ahead”. Zuhro was trained very well. She decided to open her business. She wants to work with cattle. 

She is planning to open a factory where she will keep big cattle and make dairy products. She needs to buy big cattle. 

Zuhro is asking for financial support for buying big cattle for organizing a new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy big cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Jura

texts.en:
Jura is a resident of Xujand town. He is 54 years old and lives with his family

For 5 years, he has been engaged in the building business. His wife is businesswoman who sells clothing. They have only one son who is 19 years old.  

Jura is a caring father; he is working very hard for his son's future. His son studies at the university in the economics faculty. Now he must pay for his education, but he does not have enough money. That is why Jura wants to access credit.

As Jura said, his son is a diligent and responsible person. With the help of Kiva lenders, he will be able to continue his education and, in the future, become a good specialist.

loans.use: To pay for his son's education
